analyzed: de ltar sems can rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //

analyzed: chu la ri mo bris pa lta bu yang kha cig ni mi dge ba la'o //

analyzed: kha cig ni dge ba la ste /

analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams kyi sems rnam pa gsum yin pa de bzhin du ngag kyang rnam pa gsum mo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:üîΩThe Victorious One has declared that speech is

analyzed: sbrang rtsi me tog mi gtsang lta bu'i tshig / ces bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de dag kyang su'i yin zhe na /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir snying la 'bab cing dga' bar byed pas na snying la 'bab pa zhes bya'o // tshig bden pa ni me tog lta bu ste /

analyzed: tshig log pa ni mi gtsang ba lta bu ste / smad pa'i phyir tshig gsum po de dag gi nang nas /

original: tshig tha ma ni mi gtsang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshig tha ma ni mi gtsang ba lta bu ste /

analyzed: de khyod kyis spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: You should abandon that, is what it means.

original: sems can 'khor ba na 'khor ba rnams kyi spyod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems can 'khor ba na 'khor ba rnams kyi spyod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The conduct of beings transmigrating in cyclic existence is of four types.üîΩTherefore, you should abide in the supreme conduct.

original: de bas na khyod kyi spyod pa mchog la @82b gnas par bya'o zhes de la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na khyod kyi spyod pa mchog la @82b gnas par bya'o zhes de la sbyar ba'i phyir /

analyzed: snang nas mun mthar thug ces bya ba ni lha dang mi dbang thang chen po rnams kyi nang du skyes nas /

analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma mi lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mdo las ni btsun pa bud @83a * //

original: 'on kyang na tshod dang mthun par ro //

analyzed: de ltar bsams kyang gal te 'dod chags skye ba lta na chags pas chags par gyur na bud med de la dri nga ba dang sgo dgu dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bur mi gtsang ba nyid du 'ang
translated: If, thinking in this way, desire arises, then one should contemplate that very woman as impure, as foul-smelling, as having nine orifices, and so on, as will be explained.

analyzed: gal te mi gtsang ba nyid du bsams su zin yang gtsang ba'i sems byung na /
translated: If, even though one has contemplated her as impure, the idea of her as pure arises,

analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na sems bsrung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then what should one do at that time? In order to show that one should protect the mind,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúThe mind is to be guarded as one guards a deep wound, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe mind is to be guarded as one guards a deep wound,

analyzed: g-yo ba'i sems ni thos mtshungs bu lta bur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: 'dir yang bsrungs na bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bsrungs na bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: And here, if you protect it, you will attain happiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du //
translated: The Lord has said:

original: sems dul ba ni bde ba 'thob //üîΩces gsungs ba lta bu'o /
analyzed: sems dul ba ni bde ba 'thob // ces gsungs ba lta bu'o /
translated: ‚ÄúThe tamed mind attains happiness.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover, you should be disgusted with the pleasures of desire, as with a snake, etc.

analyzed: gzhan yang gdug pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod pa'i bde ba dag la yid 'byung bar gyis shig / de la gdug pa ni sbrul lo //

analyzed: de ni ma rungs pa nyid kyis yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: It is a cause of disgust because of its wickedness.

analyzed: mtshon ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: A weapon is a cause of disgust because it is the cause of suffering.

analyzed: dgra ngo ni bde ba'i gegs byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: An enemy is a cause of disgust because he is the cause of the obstruction of happiness.

original: mi ni gdung bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi ni gdung bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: A man is a cause of disgust because he is the cause of torment.

analyzed: yul rnams kyang bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i rgyu nyid kyis gdug pa bzhin du ma rungs pa yin no //

analyzed: ngan song 'dren par byed pa'i phyir mtshon bzhin du sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thag srid par byed pa'i phyir dgra bo bzhin du bde ba'i gegs byed pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i phyir me bzhin du gdung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa'i @83b bde la yid 'byung mdzod //

analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams ni phung ba skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, desire generates ruin.

original: de'i phyir yang 'dod pa'i bde ba dag la yid 'byung bar gyis shig / yang na ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba dag la gdug pa la sogs pa bzhin du yid 'byung bar bya zhe na /

original: 'dod pa rnams ni phung ba skyed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni phung ba skyed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Desire is the generator of misfortune, etc.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúfor‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: de dag ni nye bar spyod pa'i dus na bde ba skyed mod kyis /
analyzed: de dag ni nye bar spyod pa'i dus na bde ba skyed mod kyis /
translated: They do generate pleasure when they are enjoyed.

original: 'on kyang mjug tu phung bskyed par byed pa kho na yin pas mkhas pa rnams kyis kha zas dug can bzhin spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mjug tu phung bskyed par byed pa kho na yin pas mkhas pa rnams kyis kha zas dug can bzhin spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: However, they are only the generator of misfortune in the end. Therefore, the wise should only reject them, as if they were poisoned food.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams ni dang po dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang tha mar yongs su gdung bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams ni dang po dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang tha mar yongs su gdung bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus, desire is only the generator of misfortune in the end, because it is pleasant in the beginning and because it is painful in the end.

original: rgyal ba'i dbang pos kimpa'i 'bras 'drar gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbang pos kimpa'i 'bras 'drar gsungs //
translated: The Lord of Victors has said that desire is like a kimpaka fruit.

original: dper na kimpa'i 'bras bu shun pa tsam zhig bzang gi nang ngan pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na kimpa'i 'bras bu shun pa tsam zhig bzang gi nang ngan pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the fruit of the kimpaka tree is good only as a husk, but its kernel is bad.

original: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams ni 'khor bar 'ching pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir yang spang bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes de ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams ni 'khor bar 'ching pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir yang spang bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes de ston par byed de /
translated: Moreover, sense objects should be abandoned because they are the cause for being bound in cyclic existence.üîΩThis is taught by the verse:

original: de'i lcags sgrog gis 'khor ba'i btson rar 'jig rten 'di dag bcings zhes bya ba ni yul gyi lcags sgrog gi 'khor ba'i btson rar sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di bcings so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i lcags sgrog gis 'khor ba'i btson rar 'jig rten 'di dag bcings zhes bya ba ni yul gyi lcags sgrog gi 'khor ba'i btson rar sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di bcings so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: These worlds are bound by the fetters of sense objects in the prison of cyclic existence.

original: da ni gang zhig dbang po tshar gcod par byed pa de sngags pa'i sgo nas de la sran bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gang zhig dbang po tshar gcod par byed pa de sngags pa'i sgo nas de la sran bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to generate patience toward those who harm the faculties, he says:

original: gang dag dbang po drug yul rnams la ni //
analyzed: gang dag dbang po drug yul rnams la ni //
translated: Those who harm the six faculties

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: yul dang phrad nas 'gyur ba'i phyir de la mi brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang phrad nas 'gyur ba'i phyir de la mi brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called unstable because they arise in contact with sense objects.

original: yul la mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyis g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: yul la mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyis g-yo ba yin no //
translated: They are moving because of their manifest desire for sense objects.

original: gang dag ci dbang po drug po de dag las rgyal bar byed pa dang gang dag cig 'thab mo'i g-yul ngor dgra'i tshogs las rgyal bar byed pa de dag las mkhas shing mdzangs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gang dag ci dbang po drug po de dag las rgyal bar byed pa dang gang dag cig 'thab mo'i g-yul ngor dgra'i tshogs las rgyal bar byed pa de dag las mkhas shing mdzangs pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who conquer the six sense faculties and those who conquer the hosts of enemies in the battle of war, among them the wise and the brave

original: dang po dbang po las rgyal bar byed pa gang dag yin pa dpa' rab legs par 'tshal te 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha ftshig go ;
analyzed: dang po dbang po las rgyal bar byed pa gang dag yin pa dpa' rab legs par 'tshal te 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha ftshig go ;
translated: are the best. I understand that those who conquer the sense faculties are the best heroes.

original: /'di ltar dud 'gro yang g-yul las rgyal bar snang ste /
analyzed: /'di ltar dud 'gro yang g-yul las rgyal bar snang ste /
translated: Thus, it appears that animals also conquer in battle.

original: de dag gis dbang po las rgyal bar bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag gis dbang po las rgyal bar bya bar mi nus so //
translated: But they are not able to conquer the sense faculties.

original: gang yang mi gtsang ba nyid du 'ang yang dag bsam par bgyi zhes bshad pa de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbud med gzhon nu'i lus ni logs shig tu //
analyzed: gang yang mi gtsang ba nyid du 'ang yang dag bsam par bgyi zhes bshad pa de bstan pa'i phyir / bud med gzhon nu'i lus ni logs shig tu //
translated: Now, in order to teach that one should also properly contemplate the body as impure,üîΩhe says:

original: zhes bya ba @84a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba @84a * //
translated: The body of a young woman is not to be contemplated as pure.

original: la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: de la lus zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lus dri nga ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul du re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lus dri nga ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul du re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: There, the word ‚Äúbody‚Äù should be applied to each, as in the case of the body with a foul smell.

original: 'dir lus ni dri ra ba dang // dbyibs dang / mi gtsang ba'i rten dang ngoms mi shes pa dang / khong na snying po med pa'i sgo nas bzang po ma yin pa rnam pa lnga smos so //
analyzed: 'dir lus ni dri ra ba dang // dbyibs dang / mi gtsang ba'i rten dang ngoms mi shes pa dang / khong na snying po med pa'i sgo nas bzang po ma yin pa rnam pa lnga smos so //
translated: Here, the body is not good in five ways: as a receptacle of urine and excrement, as a shape, as a support of impurity, as insatiable, and as having no core.

original: de bas na bud med gzhon nu'i lus 'di lta bu yang logs shig tu ltos la /
analyzed: de bas na bud med gzhon nu'i lus 'di lta bu yang logs shig tu ltos la /

analyzed: rgyan yang logs shig tu ltos shig dang de nas 'dod chags kyi me zhi bar 'gyur gyi /

original: gang gi tshe rgyan rnams dang / lus gcig tu zlum ste bltas pa de'i tshe ni 'dod chags kyi me mched pa kho nar 'gyur bas khyod kyis de ltar blta bar mi bya'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //

translated: But when you see the ornaments and the body as a single whole, then the fire of your passion will only blaze up. You should not look at it that way.

original: gzhan yang ngoms par bya ba'i phyir lus la nye bar spyod par 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngoms par bya ba'i phyir lus la nye bar spyod par 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if you want to enjoy the body in order to be satisfied,

analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la ni bskal pa brgya phrag tu yang ngoms pa med pas de dag bsten te ci bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: since you are never satisfied with sensual pleasures even in hundreds of eons, what is the point of pursuing them?

original: ji ltar mdze can srin bus nyen pa na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: ji ltar mdze can srin bus btsugs pa bsal ba'i phyir mi bsten kyang zhi bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du byis pa dag 'dod pa'i gdung ba bsal ba'i phyir yul rnams bsten kyang ngoms par mi 'gyur gyi rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba 'ba' shig tu zad
analyzed: ji ltar mdze can srin bus btsugs pa bsal ba'i phyir mi bsten kyang zhi bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du byis pa dag 'dod pa'i gdung ba bsal ba'i phyir yul rnams bsten kyang ngoms par mi 'gyur gyi rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba 'ba' shig tu zad
translated: Just as a leper‚Äôs sores erupt when treated with medicinal ointments, but not when they are not treated, so the sores of the passions erupt when the fool indulges in sensual pleasures, but not when he does not indulge in them.

original: de / 'di ni re zhig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par gnon pa'i sbyor ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de / 'di ni re zhig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par gnon pa'i sbyor ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This, then, is the application to the conquest of the lust for sensual pleasure.üîΩSince this is not the complete conquest, he says,

original: 'di tsam gyis ni de kun du 'chad pa ma yin pas khyod de kun du gcad par 'dod na lam 'di bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says,

original: dngos rnams la /

translated: Because it is the opposite of that.üîΩYou should not commit evil deeds for the sake of

original: khyod kyis bram ze dge slong lha dang ni //
analyzed: khyod kyis bram ze dge slong lha dang ni //
translated: monks, brahmins, gods, guests,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / khyod kyis dge slong dang bram ze dang lha dad mgron dang ma la sogs pa 'di dag gi don du sdig pa mi bya'o //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dmyal ba'i rnam smin skal nod 'ga' ma mchis // zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: 'di dag gi don du sdig pa byas pa yang khyod kho na dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang sbyor bar byed kyis /

original: ma la sogs pa de dag dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi skal pa len par mi byed do //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa de dag dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi skal pa len par mi byed do //

analyzed: gal te bram ze la sogs pa'i don du sdig pa byas pa rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa can du gyur na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i mod la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur snyam du sems na / sdig pa'i las rnams spyad pa 'ga' yang ni //
translated: why don‚Äôt they ripen right now?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThere is no one who can take over the results of your hells,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du sdig pa'i las kyis de'i mod kho na la mtshon cha bzhin du gcod par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du sdig pa'i las kyis de'i mod kho na la mtshon cha bzhin du gcod par mi byed mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa na sdig pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mngon par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, when the time of death arrives, the results of your sins will manifest.‚Äù

original: dus de'i tshe dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang byas pa de mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las gang byas pa de mngon du 'gyur te /

analyzed: dper na phye ma red kyi dus su ri brtsegs pa rnams kyi grib so 'bab pa lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the falling of shadows from the mountains at the time of dusk.

original: de mthong nas kha cig ni bzhin mdangs gsal bzhin du 'chi 'o //
analyzed: de mthong nas kha cig ni bzhin mdangs gsal bzhin du 'chi 'o //
translated: Having seen that, some die with a clear complexion.

original: gzhan dag ni bzhin gyi mdog ngan par gyur nas 'chi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bzhin gyi mdog ngan par gyur nas 'chi'o //
translated: Others die with an unpleasant complexion.

original: de dag kho na la dmigs nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems 'byung @85b ste ;
analyzed: de dag kho na la dmigs nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems 'byung @85b ste ;
translated: After observing just those, the mind of rebirth occurs immediately after the mind of death.

original: / de'i tshe na las kyi rnam par smin pa smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de'i tshe na las kyi rnam par smin pa smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the ripening of karma ripens.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The result is the ripening.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi chos rnams dang phul te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi chos rnams dang phul te /
translated: Thus, having explained the worldly dharmas,

original: 'phags pa'i chos la dgongs par bzhed nas dad dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos la dgongs par bzhed nas dad dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: with the intention of explaining the noble dharmas, he says faith, morality, etc.

original: de la dad pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clear conviction in action and result, the Truths, and the Three Jewels.

original: tshul khrims ni mi dge ba spong ba yang dag par len pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni mi dge ba spong ba yang dag par len pa'o //
translated: Morality is the taking up of the relinquishment of the unwholesome.

original: de yang sngom pa rnam par brgyad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sngom pa rnam par brgyad du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as the eight vows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dge slong gi sdom pa dang / dge slong ma'i sdom pa dang / dge sbyong gi sdom pa dang / dge sbyong ma'i sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa dang / bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa dang / dge slong ma'i sdom pa dang / dge sbyong gi sdom pa dang / dge sbyong ma'i sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa dang / bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: the vow of the monk, the vow of the nun, the vow of the male novice, the vow of the female novice, the vow of the male and female devotee, and the vow of the one day devotee.

original: gtang ba ni mchod pa dang phan 'dogs par 'dod pas ci rigs par dngos po gtong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtang ba ni mchod pa dang phan 'dogs par 'dod pas ci rigs par dngos po gtong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Giving is the relinquishing of things by one who desires to make offerings and to help others, as is appropriate.

original: thos pa ni dge ba'i bsam pas thar pa dang / mthun pa'i chos mnyan pa dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni dge ba'i bsam pas thar pa dang / mthun pa'i chos mnyan pa dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Learning is the listening to and grasping of the Dharma which is conducive to liberation, with a virtuous attitude.

original: dri med ces smos pas ni thos pa rnam par byang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: dri med ces smos pas ni thos pa rnam par byang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äústainless‚Äù shows that learning is itself the purification.

original: ngo tsha shes pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Shame is the opposite of that.üîΩ

original: kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Shame is the avoidance of what is objectionable, on account of oneself.üîΩDecorum is the avoidance of what is objectionable, on account of others.

original: khrel yod pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas mdzem pa gang yin pa dang / shes rab ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed par zhugs ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas kha na ma tho bas mdzem pa gang yin pa dang / shes rab ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed par zhugs ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: de dag ni nor bdun lags par thub pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag ni nor bdun lags par thub pas gsungs te /
translated: These are the seven jewels taught by the Sage,

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of undefiled bliss and because they are not common to all.

original: gser la sogs pa 'jig rten na grags pa'i nor gzhan ni /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa 'jig rten na grags pa'i nor gzhan ni /
translated: Other jewels, such as gold, which are common in the world,

original: don ma mchis shing gsob dang yam bral ste /
analyzed: don ma mchis shing gsob dang yam bral ste /
translated: are useless, hollow, and empty,

original: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the cause of the appeasement of the afflictions and because they are common to all.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i nor bsags par bshad nas de chud mi za ba'i thabs /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i nor bsags par bshad nas de chud mi za ba'i thabs /
translated: Having explained the accumulation of the jewels of the Aryas, the means of not wasting them is stated:

original: rgyan po 'gyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyan po 'gyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Gambling, etc.

original: de la rgyan po 'gyed pa ni cho lo 'i rgyan po 'gyed pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: de la rgyan po 'gyed pa ni cho lo 'i rgyan po 'gyed pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: Gambling is the various forms of gambling with dice, etc.

original: 'dus pa la lta ba ni dga' ston la sogs pa la skye bo phal po che 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa la lta ba ni dga' ston la sogs pa la skye bo phal po che 'dus pa'o //
translated: Spectator sports are the assemblies of people for festivals, etc.

original: le lo ni dge ba byas pa dag la mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: le lo ni dge ba byas pa dag la mi spro ba'o //
translated: Laziness is the lack of enthusiasm for doing what is wholesome.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po ni gang zag gang la brten nas dge ba la mi 'jug la mi dge ba la ni 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po ni gang zag gang la brten nas dge ba la mi 'jug la mi dge ba la ni 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Evil friends are those persons in dependence on whom one does not engage in what is wholesome and engages in what is unwholesome.

original: chang ni bcos pa'i chang dang sbyar ba'i chang ngo //
analyzed: chang ni bcos pa'i chang dang sbyar ba'i chang ngo //
translated: Liquor is both distilled and fermented.

original: @86a * // mtshan mo rgyu ba ni nyi ma nub pa dang khyim gzhan dang grong gzhan la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: @86a * // mtshan mo rgyu ba ni nyi ma nub pa dang khyim gzhan dang grong gzhan la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Wandering at night is going to other houses, other villages, etc. after sunset.

original: drug po de dag ni ngan song ba yin ta /
analyzed: drug po de dag ni ngan song ba yin ta /
translated: These six are the causes of the unfortunate realms,

original: de dag la brten nas longs spyod dang / 'tsho ba dang dge ba'i chos nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas longs spyod dang / 'tsho ba dang dge ba'i chos nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in dependence on them one's resources, livelihood, and wholesome actions decline.

original: ngan song gi rgyu la ngan song zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ngan song gi rgyu la ngan song zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of the miserable realms is called a miserable realm,

original: dper na na sman la tshe zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na na sman la tshe zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as medicine is called a life-force.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las ni khyim bdag gi bu drug po 'di dag ni ngan song gi sgo yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las ni khyim bdag gi bu drug po 'di dag ni ngan song gi sgo yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúHouseholder, these six are doors to the miserable realms.‚Äù

original: der ni rgyu'i don yin par gsal ba kho nar go'o //
analyzed: der ni rgyu'i don yin par gsal ba kho nar go'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of cause is clearly understood.

original: grags pa nyams par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni de dag gi nyes dmigs gzhan ston to //
analyzed: grags pa nyams par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni de dag gi nyes dmigs gzhan ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúreputation is ruined‚Äù indicates another disadvantage of these.üîΩTherefore, since this is so, you should abandon these through completely rejecting their practice.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pas de dag lhag par spyod pa yongs su spang ba'i sgo nas spongs shig / yang phyi'i nor gyi gnyen por kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pas de dag lhag par spyod pa yongs su spang ba'i sgo nas spongs shig / yang phyi'i nor gyi gnyen por kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another method for eliminating external wealth without afflictions,

original: nor rnams kun gyi nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nor rnams kun gyi nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúAmong all wealth,‚Äù and so on.

original: gser la sogs pa phyi'i nor thams cad pas ni chog shes pa'i nor rab mchog ste /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa phyi'i nor thams cad pas ni chog shes pa'i nor rab mchog ste /
translated: It is said that the wealth of contentment is the best and most excellent of all external wealth, such as gold, and so on.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be superior.

original: sus shes na lha mi'i ston pas te /
analyzed: sus shes na lha mi'i ston pas te /
translated: Who knows this? The Teacher of gods and men.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad du gsungs pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka'i rjes su 'brangs pa khyod kyis chog shes par gyis shig snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad du gsungs pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka'i rjes su 'brangs pa khyod kyis chog shes par gyis shig snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Since the Bhagavat has said this, therefore, you who follow the word of the Tathagata, be content!

original: chog shas pa la yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: chog shas pa la yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the good quality of being content?

original: chog mkhyen na /
analyzed: chog mkhyen na /
translated: If one is content,

original: nor mi bdog kyang yang dag 'byor pa lags //üîΩzhas bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nor mi bdog kyang yang dag 'byor pa lags // zhas bya ba smos te /
translated: one is truly wealthy even without possessing wealth.üîΩThis is what is said.

original: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNa‚Äù means ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: nor mi bdog pa ni gser la sogs pa'i nor med pas so //
analyzed: nor mi bdog pa ni gser la sogs pa'i nor med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout possessing wealth‚Äù means without gold and so on.

original: de yang chog shes pas yang dag par 'byor pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang chog shes pas yang dag par 'byor pa yin te /
translated: That is also ‚Äútruly wealth‚Äù because of being content.

original: nor gyi 'bras bu ni chog shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nor gyi 'bras bu ni chog shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The result of wealth is being content.

original: gal te nor med du zin kyang chog shes na dbul bzhin du yang nor dang ldan pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nor med du zin kyang chog shes na dbul bzhin du yang nor dang ldan pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Even if one is not wealthy, if one is content, one should be known as being wealthy, even though poor.

original: chog shes pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chog shes pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is contentment?

original: gang zhig 'das pa la rjes su mya ngan mi byed /
analyzed: gang zhig 'das pa la rjes su mya ngan mi byed /
translated: It is the absence of regret for what is past,

original: ma'ongs pa la mngon par 'dod pa mi byed /
analyzed: ma'ongs pa la mngon par 'dod pa mi byed /
translated: the absence of anticipation for the future,

original: da ltar byung ba lta lhag par chags pa med pa de'i chos gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba lta lhag par chags pa med pa de'i chos gang yin pa ste /
translated: and the absence of excessive attachment to the present.

original: des na 'di la chog shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di la chog shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called contentment.

original: de ltar chog shes pa'i yon tan bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar chog shes pa'i yon tan bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the virtues of contentment,

original: chog mi shes pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan pa'i @86b phyir ;
analyzed: chog mi shes pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan pa'i @86b phyir ;
translated: in order to demonstrate the faults of discontentment,

original: des pa bdog mang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des pa bdog mang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe contented person, O monks, is happy,‚Äù and so on.

original: des bzhes bya ba ni bod pa yin no //
analyzed: des bzhes bya ba ni bod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe contented person‚Äù means the contented monk.

original: snod spyod pa la sogs pa yo byad mang po bdog pa rnams ji ltar bsrung ba dang sba ba la sogs pa dang / chud zos na yang sdug bsngal skye ba ltar yo byad mang po mi bdog pa rnams la ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: snod spyod pa la sogs pa yo byad mang po bdog pa rnams ji ltar bsrung ba dang sba ba la sogs pa dang / chud zos na yang sdug bsngal skye ba ltar yo byad mang po mi bdog pa rnams la ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: Those who have many possessions such as household goods have much suffering from protecting, hiding, and so on, and from the fear of loss. But those who have few possessions do not have such suffering.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know this?

original: klu mchog rnams kyi mgo bo ji snyed pa //
analyzed: klu mchog rnams kyi mgo bo ji snyed pa //
translated: As many heads as the best of nagas have,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: so many sufferings arise from them.

original: dper na klu gang la mgo bo bdun yod pa de la de dag las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang de snyed kho na yod la /
analyzed: dper na klu gang la mgo bo bdun yod pa de la de dag las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang de snyed kho na yod la /
translated: For example, a naga who has seven heads has that many sufferings arising from them.

original: gang la gsum yod pa de la ni ches nyung du yod /
analyzed: gang la gsum yod pa de la ni ches nyung du yod /
translated: One who has three has much less.

original: gang la gcig yod pa de la ni ches shin tu nyung du yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang la gcig yod pa de la ni ches shin tu nyung du yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: One who has one has very little.

original: bdog pa'i khyad par gyis bsdug bsngal gyi khyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdog pa'i khyad par gyis bsdug bsngal gyi khyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the difference in suffering should be understood from the difference in possessions.

original: khyim na gnas pa rnams la bud med yongs su bzung ba mi 'gal ba'i phyir de dag gi skyon dang yon tan dpyad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa rnams la bud med yongs su bzung ba mi 'gal ba'i phyir de dag gi skyon dang yon tan dpyad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not contradictory for householders to have wives, the method of being free from afflictions is taught by analyzing the faults and qualities of wives.üîΩ

original: rang bzhin dgrar 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dgrar 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since it is not contradictory for householders to have wives, in order to teach the method of being free from defilement by examining the faults and virtues of wives, he says, ‚ÄúNaturally hostile, etc.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyis dgra dang 'brel zhing ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dgra dang 'brel zhing ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally hostile‚Äù means naturally connected with, or endowed with, hostility.

original: chung ma de 'dra ba ni gshed ma lta bu yin te /
analyzed: chung ma de 'dra ba ni gshed ma lta bu yin te /
translated: Such a wife is like an executioner.

original: de bas na spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, she should be abandoned.

original: de las rang bzhin gyis dgra ni gang zhig skyes pa gsod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de las rang bzhin gyis dgra ni gang zhig skyes pa gsod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Among them, a natural enemy is one who wishes to kill a man.

original: khyim thab brnyas bgyid ces bya ba ni khyod la brnyas pa byed pas na khyim thab brnyas bgyid de /
analyzed: khyim thab brnyas bgyid ces bya ba ni khyod la brnyas pa byed pas na khyim thab brnyas bgyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúInsulting the husband‚Äù means that she insults you, so she is insulting the husband.

original: bud med de 'dra ba ni jo mo dang mtshungs pas de yang spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: bud med de 'dra ba ni jo mo dang mtshungs pas de yang spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Such a wife is like a mistress, so she too should be abandoned.

original: chung ma gang zhig chung ngu rku ba de yang chom rkun ma lta bu yin pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: chung ma gang zhig chung ngu rku ba de yang chom rkun ma lta bu yin pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: A wife who steals even a little is like a thief and should be abandoned.

original: 'o na chung ma ci 'dra ba cig blang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chung ma ci 'dra ba cig blang bar bya zhe na /
translated: What kind of wife should one take?

original: sring mo lta bur rjes mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sring mo lta bur rjes mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: She should be like a sister, following her husband‚Äôs wishes.

original: ji ltar sring mo ming po'i rjes su mthun zhing de'i tshig khyad du mi gsod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sring mo ming po'i rjes su mthun zhing de'i tshig khyad du mi gsod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a sister follows her brother‚Äôs wishes and does not disobey his words,

original: chung ma khyo'i rjes su mthun pa gang yin pa de ni bkur ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chung ma khyo'i rjes su mthun pa gang yin pa de ni bkur ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: so a wife who follows her husband‚Äôs wishes is respected.

original: ji ltar mdza' bo mdza' mo'i snying la 'bab cing rim gror bya ba'i khyad par de dang des snying dga' ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mdza' bo mdza' mo'i snying la 'bab cing rim gror bya ba'i khyad par de dang des snying dga' ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a friend is pleasing to a lover and delights his heart with special service,

original: khyo'i snying la 'bab pa'i chung ma gang yin pa de yang bkur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: khyo'i snying la 'bab pa'i chung ma gang yin pa de yang bkur ba kho na yin no //
translated: so a wife who is pleasing to her husband is respected.

original: ji ltar ma bu la lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pas phan par 'dod cing phan par 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa de bzhin du khyo la phan par 'dod pa'i chung ma gang yin pa de yang bkur pa kho @87a * //üîΩna yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ma bu la lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pas phan par 'dod cing phan par 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa de bzhin du khyo la phan par 'dod pa'i chung ma gang yin pa de yang bkur pa kho @87a * // na yin no //
translated: Just as a mother, who desires to benefit her son and has the nature of desiring to benefit him, desires that he be free from physical and mental suffering, so too a wife who desires to benefit her husband is also only respectful.

original: bran mo bzhin du dbang bsgyur gang yin pa ste ji ltar bran mo dga' mgur byar yod pa nyid kyi dbang du 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyo'i dbang du 'gyur ba'i chung ma gang yin pa de ni bkur ba kho na yin no //üîΩchung ma bzhi po de dag ni rigs kyi lha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bran mo bzhin du dbang bsgyur gang yin pa ste ji ltar bran mo dga' mgur byar yod pa nyid kyi dbang du 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyo'i dbang du 'gyur ba'i chung ma gang yin pa de ni bkur ba kho na yin no // chung ma bzhi po de dag ni rigs kyi lha zhes bya ste /
translated: A wife who is controlled like a servant is also only respectful. Just as a servant is controlled by the mere will of the one who is pleased, so too a wife who is controlled by the will of her husband is also only respectful.

original: rigs mi nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These four types of wives are called ‚Äúwives of the clan‚Äù because they are the cause for not degenerating the clan.

original: 'di man chad ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: From here on, in order to apply to meditative stabilization,

original: bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba ston to //
translated: the preparation for meditative stabilization is taught.

original: bsam gtan la gces pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la gces pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two things cherished in meditative stabilization:

original: zas kyi tshod zin pa dang / mi nyal bar brtson pa'o //
analyzed: zas kyi tshod zin pa dang / mi nyal bar brtson pa'o //
translated: moderation in eating, and striving to remain awake.

original: de la re zhig zas kyi tshod zin pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩkha zas sman dang 'dra bar rigs pa yis //
analyzed: de la re zhig zas kyi tshod zin pa'i dbang du byas nas / kha zas sman dang 'dra bar rigs pa yis //
translated: moderation in eating, and striving not to sleep during the first and last periods of the night.üîΩWith regard to the first of these,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: one should eat food in the proper manner, as if it were medicine.

original: lus ni rma lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni rma lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is like a wound.

original: dper na sman ha cang yang nyung du ma yin ha cang mang po yang ma yin par btang na /
analyzed: dper na sman ha cang yang nyung du ma yin ha cang mang po yang ma yin par btang na /
translated: For example, if medicine is taken neither too little nor too much,üîΩthen it will be helpful.

original: de lta na phan thogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du zas kyang ha cang nyung du yang ma yin ha cang mang po yang ma yin par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na phan thogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du zas kyang ha cang nyung du yang ma yin ha cang mang po yang ma yin par bstan par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, food should be eaten neither too little nor too much.

original: de lta na lus kyang bstan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na lus kyang bstan par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is eaten in this way, the body will be maintained

original: gnod pa yang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa yang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and no harm will arise.

original: don 'di nyid rigs pa yis zhes bya ba 'dis ston par byed do //
analyzed: don 'di nyid rigs pa yis zhes bya ba 'dis ston par byed do //
translated: This very point is taught by the words, ‚Äúin the proper manner.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang med par bsten bgyi ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang med par bsten bgyi ste //
translated: One should eat without desire or aversion.

original: zhes bya ba ni de tsam du bza' ba gang yin pa de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag dang ma 'brel bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de tsam du bza' ba gang yin pa de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag dang ma 'brel bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not eat to that extent, but rather one should not eat in a manner associated with passion and aversion.

original: ji ltar zhe na de bsten pa yang /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de bsten pa yang /
translated: How is that? He says:

original: rgyags phyir ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyags phyir ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Not for intoxication, etc.

original: rgyags par 'dod pa gang zhig rgyags par bya'o snyam pa dang 'tshag par bya'o snyam nas zas za ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags kyis za ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyags par 'dod pa gang zhig rgyags par bya'o snyam pa dang 'tshag par bya'o snyam nas zas za ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags kyis za ba yin no //
translated: One who eats food thinking ‚ÄúI shall become intoxicated‚Äù or ‚ÄúI shall become swollen‚Äù eats through passion.

original: gang zhig bsnyems pa'i phyir za ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig bsnyems pa'i phyir za ba de ni /
translated: One who eats for the sake of pride

original: bsnyems pa'i 'bras bu de ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhe sdang gis za ba yin no //
analyzed: bsnyems pa'i 'bras bu de ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhe sdang gis za ba yin no //
translated: eats through aversion, because pride is the result of aversion, and because one who is proud injures others.

original: de la rgyags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu lus dang sems kyi 'gyur ba 'ga' kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu lus dang sems kyi 'gyur ba 'ga' kho na yin no //
translated: Intoxication is a certain transformation of body and mind that is the cause of passion.

original: 'tshag ni yan lag dang nying lag rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshag ni yan lag dang nying lag rgyas pa'o //
translated: Swelling is the inflation of the major and minor limbs.

original: bsnyems pa ni nyams stobs so //
analyzed: bsnyems pa ni nyams stobs so //
translated: Pride is the inflation of the mind.

original: de dag med par lus gnas pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir te /
analyzed: de dag med par lus gnas pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir te /
translated: For the sake of merely maintaining the body,

original: srog gi dbang po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, for the sake of preserving the life faculty.

original: mi nyal bar brtson pa'i dbang du byas nas rigs pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi nyal bar brtson pa'i dbang du byas nas rigs pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With reference to striving to remain awake, the root text states, ‚Äúone who is naturally conscientious. ‚Äù

original: de la rigs pa'i bdag nyid ni dge ba la mngon par @87b brtson pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la rigs pa'i bdag nyid ni dge ba la mngon par @87b brtson pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnaturally conscientious‚Äù refers to one who is naturally devoted to virtue.

original: dge ba la sbyor bas nyin par mtha' dag 'das nas te /
analyzed: dge ba la sbyor bas nyin par mtha' dag 'das nas te /
translated: Having spent the entire day applying oneself to virtue,

original: 'das par byas nas so //
analyzed: 'das par byas nas so //
translated: having passed the day,

original: yongs su rdzogs par byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: having completed the day,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: as the Blessed One has said:

original: nyin par 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyin par 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúOne purifies the mind of those phenomena that obscure walking and sitting during the day.

original: yongs su sbyangs nas zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs nas zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Having purified the mind. ‚Äù

original: mtshan mo'i thun gyi stod smad ces bya ba ni rigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis nyin mo kho na 'da' ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun gyi stod smad ces bya ba ni rigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis nyin mo kho na 'da' ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: The first and last watches of the night: the master of reasoning does not spend the day only.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does he do?

original: rigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mtshan mo yang cha stod dang cha smad 'das nas te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mtshan mo yang cha stod dang cha smad 'das nas te /
translated: The master of reasoning also spends the first and last parts of the night.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du mtshan mo'i thun dang po la 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //üîΩyongs su sbyangs nas thun par ma la gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus te /üîΩgtsug lag khang du zhugs nas glo g-yas ba phab ste /üîΩrkang pa'i thog tu rkang pa bzhag la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du mtshan mo'i thun dang po la 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do // yongs su sbyangs nas thun par ma la gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus te / gtsug lag khang du zhugs nas glo g-yas ba phab ste / rkang pa'i thog tu rkang pa bzhag la /
translated: As the Blessed One said: ‚ÄúIn the first watch of the night, I purify my mind of obscurations through walking and sitting and I strive in the investigation of the Dharma.üîΩHaving purified it, in the middle watch of the night, I lie down on the right side in the lion‚Äôs pose, foot placed on foot, mindful and aware, having given rise to the thought of rising.

original: dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du seng ge'i gzims thabs su nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du seng ge'i gzims thabs su nyal bar byed do //
translated: In the last watch of the night, I rise and having gone outside, I wash my feet and enter the monastery.üîΩHaving sat down on a seat prepared in advance, I engage in the investigation of the Dharma until the sun rises.

original: de thun tha ma la myur ba myur bar langs nas 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de thun tha ma la myur ba myur bar langs nas 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: In the last watch of the night, he rises quickly and, by walking and sitting, he purifies his mind of the dharmas that obscure it.

original: de dag bar du mnol zhes bya ba ni thun dang po dang thun tha ma dag gi bar gyi thun gang yin pa der nyol cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag bar du mnol zhes bya ba ni thun dang po dang thun tha ma dag gi bar gyi thun gang yin pa der nyol cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúHe should sleep in between‚Äù means that he should sleep in the watch of the night that is between the first and the last watches.

original: de yang gyi na nyal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gyi na nyal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But he should not sleep as if sick.

original: 'on kyang ring por mi thogs par langs la dge ba bya'o snyam pa'i dran pa dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ring por mi thogs par langs la dge ba bya'o snyam pa'i dran pa dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: Rather, he should be mindful, thinking, ‚ÄúI will rise up before long and do what is wholesome.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i dran pa nye bar bzhag nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dran pa nye bar bzhag nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving established such mindfulness‚Äù is that he should sleep in that way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mnal tshe'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mnal tshe'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven while sleeping, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du lus dge ba la sbyor bzod par byas nas langs te /
analyzed: 'di skad du lus dge ba la sbyor bzod par byas nas langs te /
translated: This is what he should think: ‚ÄúHaving made my body capable of enduring the application to what is wholesome, I will rise up.

original: dge ba bya'o snyam pa de lta bus nyal ba ni gnyid log kyang dge ba'i sems pa sngon du gtong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba bya'o snyam pa de lta bus nyal ba ni gnyid log kyang dge ba'i sems pa sngon du gtong ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase one should go to sleep with the thought 'I will do what is virtuous' means that even when one falls asleep, one goes to sleep after first sending forth a virtuous intention.

original: dge ba kho na skye bar 'gyur bas dus de na yang tshe don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba kho na skye bar 'gyur bas dus de na yang tshe don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since only what is virtuous is produced, one does not waste one's life even at that time.

original: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung bar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung bar byas nas /
translated: Having thus made the body and mind serviceable,

original: bsam gtan gyi spyor ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi spyor ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the practice of meditative concentration,üîΩhe says,

original: byams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩbyams pa la sogs pa ni bsam gtan @88a * //
analyzed: byams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / byams pa la sogs pa ni bsam gtan @88a * //
translated: lovingkindness, and so on.

original: gyi sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: gyi sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Lovingkindness, and so on, are the practice of meditative concentration,

original: de dag la goms pas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la goms pas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the first meditative concentration, and so on, are produced by cultivating them.

original: de la byams par byed pas na byams pa ste /
analyzed: de la byams par byed pas na byams pa ste /
translated: Among them, lovingkindness is that which makes loving;

original: sdug par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it makes lovable.

original: snying rje bar byed pas ni snying rje ste /
analyzed: snying rje bar byed pas ni snying rje ste /
translated: Compassion is that which makes compassionate;

original: sdug bsngal bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it makes one not suffer.

original: dga' bar byed pas na dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dga' bar byed pas na dga' ba ste /
translated: Joy is that which makes joyful;üîΩthe meaning is that it makes one happy.

original: rangs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩrigs par lta bas na btang snyoms te /
analyzed: rangs par byed ces bya ba'i don to // rigs par lta bas na btang snyoms te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto delight‚Äù is to be satisfied.üîΩ‚Äú Equanimity‚Äù means to view things in an appropriate way.

original: phyogs su ma lhung bar lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs su ma lhung bar lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto view things in an appropriate way‚Äù is to view things without falling into extremes.

original: byams pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is loving-kindness?

original: sems can rnams la bde ba dang sprod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bde ba dang sprod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is the attitude of wishing that sentient beings have happiness.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the attitude of wishing that they be free from suffering.

original: dga' ba ni bde ba dang mi 'bral ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni bde ba dang mi 'bral ba'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Sympathetic joy is the attitude of wishing that they never be separated from happiness.

original: btang snyoms ni bar ma gnas pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bar ma gnas pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is the attitude of wishing that they remain in a state of neutrality.

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po de dag rtag tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po de dag rtag tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should always cultivate these four qualities of loving-kindness and so on.

original: de la re zhig byams pa bsgom par 'dod pa ni tshul khrims yongs su sbyangs nas /
analyzed: de la re zhig byams pa bsgom par 'dod pa ni tshul khrims yongs su sbyangs nas /
translated: With regard to that, one who wishes to cultivate loving-kindness should purify his morality and then

original: phyogs dben pa zhig tu stan bde ba la 'dug cing sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan rjes su dran pas sems bzang po bskyed de /
analyzed: phyogs dben pa zhig tu stan bde ba la 'dug cing sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan rjes su dran pas sems bzang po bskyed de /
translated: sit on a comfortable seat in an isolated place. He should generate a virtuous mind by recollecting the good qualities of the Buddha and so on.

original: gang zag yon tan dang ldan pa bkur sti bya bar 'os pa /
analyzed: gang zag yon tan dang ldan pa bkur sti bya bar 'os pa /
translated: A person who has good qualities is worthy of respect.

original: bla ma lta bu'i gnas zhig la dad pa bskyed nas skyes bu dam pa 'di bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i yid la byed pa 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: bla ma lta bu'i gnas zhig la dad pa bskyed nas skyes bu dam pa 'di bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i yid la byed pa 'jug par byed de /
translated: One should generate faith in a person who possesses good qualities and is worthy of respect, such as a guru, and engage the mind by thinking, ‚ÄúMay this holy person be happy.‚Äù

original: ji srid du 'di'i sems chung du byung ba de srid du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du 'di'i sems chung du byung ba de srid du 'jug par byed do //
translated: One should engage the mind as long as it is small.

original: de nas gang zag sdug pa la sems gtod par byed de /
analyzed: de nas gang zag sdug pa la sems gtod par byed de /
translated: Then one should focus the mind on a pleasant person.

original: de la yang ji srid du 'di la gang zag snga ma dang mnyam pa'i sems skyes pa de srid du sems gtod par byed do //
analyzed: de la yang ji srid du 'di la gang zag snga ma dang mnyam pa'i sems skyes pa de srid du sems gtod par byed do //
translated: One should focus the mind on that person as long as the mind is equal to the previous person.

original: de nas gang zag tha ma la gtod par byed de /
analyzed: de nas gang zag tha ma la gtod par byed de /
translated: Then one should focus the mind on an average person.

original: de srid du gang zag tha ma gnyis dang mnyam pa'i sems skyes pa de srid du gtod par byed do //
analyzed: de srid du gang zag tha ma gnyis dang mnyam pa'i sems skyes pa de srid du gtod par byed do //
translated: One should focus the mind on that person as long as the mind is equal to the previous two persons.

original: de nas gang zag mi sdug pa la sems gtod par byed de /üîΩde la yang de srid du gtod par byed do //
analyzed: de nas gang zag mi sdug pa la sems gtod par byed de /üîΩde la yang de srid du gtod par byed do //
translated: Then one should focus the mind on an unpleasant person.üîΩOne should focus the mind on that person as long as it is equal to the previous person.

original: gal te 'di la gang zag sha khon can zhig yod na de la 'di bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gal te 'di la gang zag sha khon can zhig yod na de la 'di bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sems skyed par byed de /
translated: If there is someone who has a grudge against him, he generates the thought, ‚ÄúMay he be happy.‚Äù

original: de la yang ji srid du snga ma dag dang lhan cig tu snyam pa'i sems skyes pa de srid du skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de la yang ji srid du snga ma dag dang lhan cig tu snyam pa'i sems skyes pa de srid du skyed par byed de /
translated: And he generates the thought, ‚ÄúMay he be happy‚Äù for as long as he generates the thought, ‚ÄúTogether with the former.‚Äù

original: 'di tsam gyis na 'di'i byams pa'i sems kyis rnam par grol ba mtshams tha dad pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na 'di'i byams pa'i sems kyis rnam par grol ba mtshams tha dad pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: To that extent, his mind of loving kindness is liberated through the cultivation of a separate stage.

original: de phyin chad ni phyogs khyab par byed pa'i dbang gis @88b yid la byed par rig par bya ste /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyi ji skad du de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pas phyogs gcig tu mos nas khyab par bya ste /
analyzed: de phyin chad ni phyogs khyab par byed pa'i dbang gis @88b yid la byed par rig par bya ste / bcom ldan 'das kyi ji skad du de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pas phyogs gcig tu mos nas khyab par bya ste /
translated: From that point on, he should be aware of the mental attention that pervades the direction.

original: rdzogs par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúHaving faith in one direction, he pervades it with a mind of loving kindness that is free from enmity, free from hatred, free from animosity, to the extent that he abides having made it pervasive, complete, and pure.‚Äù

original: snying rje ni gang zag sdug bsngal ba mgon med pa skyabs med pa la dmigs nas rim pa 'di nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni gang zag sdug bsngal ba mgon med pa skyabs med pa la dmigs nas rim pa 'di nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Compassion is to be practiced by focusing on a suffering person who is helpless and without a protector, by means of this very process.

original: dga' ba ni gang zag sdug pa la dmigs nas rim pa 'di nyid kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni gang zag sdug pa la dmigs nas rim pa 'di nyid kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Joy is to be accomplished by focusing on a dear person, by means of this very process.

original: btang snyoms ni gang zag tha mal pa la dmigs nas rim gyis sems can thams cad la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni gang zag tha mal pa la dmigs nas rim gyis sems can thams cad la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Equanimity is to be practiced by focusing on a neutral person, and then gradually extended to all sentient beings.

original: de ltar rtag tu byams pa dang / snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu byams pa dang / snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should always cultivate love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: yang byams pa la sogs pa de ltar bsgoms pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ci zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: yang byams pa la sogs pa de ltar bsgoms pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ci zhig yin zhe na //
translated: Again, what is the result of cultivating love, etc., in that way?üîΩIt is said:

original: gong ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gong ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By that, one attains the highest.

original: 'di skad du byams pa la sogs pa de ltar bsgoms pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du byams pa la sogs pa de ltar bsgoms pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by cultivating love, etc., in that way, one attains nirvana.

original: 'on te ji zhig ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob na 'on kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten bde ba thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te ji zhig ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob na 'on kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten bde ba thob par 'gyur /
translated: But if somehow one does not attain nirvana, then one will attain the bliss of the Brahma world.

original: gzugs kyi khams su 'dod pa'i khro ba'i yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba'i bsam gtan skyon med pa zhi ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su 'dod pa'i khro ba'i yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba'i bsam gtan skyon med pa zhi ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In the form realm, one will experience the faultless, peaceful meditative concentration free from the torment of desire.

original: de ltar byams pa la sogs pa yongs su grub pas bsam gtan bzhi 'thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byams pa la sogs pa yongs su grub pas bsam gtan bzhi 'thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is taught that one attains the four meditative concentrations through perfecting love and so on.

original: 'dod spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To explain this, he says ‚Äúenjoying sense objects‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar rnam par spangs zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dod pa rnam par spangs pa dang / spyod pa rnam par spangs pa dang / dga' ba rnam par spangs pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par spangs zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dod pa rnam par spangs pa dang / spyod pa rnam par spangs pa dang / dga' ba rnam par spangs pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba re re dang sbyar te /
translated: The words ‚Äúin this way, having abandoned‚Äù are applied to each of the following: ‚Äúhaving abandoned sense objects,‚Äù ‚Äúhaving abandoned conduct,‚Äù ‚Äúhaving abandoned joy,‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving abandoned pleasure and pain.‚Äù

original: da dag ni go rims bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi yin no //
analyzed: da dag ni go rims bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four meditative concentrations, respectively.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag thob pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag thob pas /
translated: By attaining these four meditative concentrations,üîΩ

original: 'bras bu ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What result is obtained by attaining those four meditative concentrations?

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the maturational result,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúBrahma,üîΩand so on,‚Äù

original: tshangs dang 'od gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshangs dang 'od gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so forth.

original: bsam gtan dang po bsgoms pas ni tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po bsgoms pas ni tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating the first meditative concentration, one is reborn with a fortune equal to that of the Brahmakayika gods.

original: gnyis pas ni 'od gsal ba rnams dang ngo //üîΩgsum pas ni dge rgyas pa rnams dang ngo //üîΩbzhi pas ni 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams dang @89a * //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni 'od gsal ba rnams dang ngo // gsum pas ni dge rgyas pa rnams dang ngo // bzhi pas ni 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams dang @89a * //
translated: By the second, one is reborn with a fortune equal to that of the Parittabha gods.üîΩBy the third, one is reborn with a fortune equal to that of the Apramanasabha gods.

original: skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the fourth, one is reborn with a fortune equal to that of the Brhatphala gods.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa 'dod pa rnam par spang ba la sogs pa ni mdo'i rjes su 'brang ba kho nas rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa 'dod pa rnam par spang ba la sogs pa ni mdo'i rjes su 'brang ba kho nas rig par bya'o /
translated: The abandonment of desire and so on in the first meditative concentration and so on should be understood only in accordance with the sutras.

original: spyod pa rnam par spangs pas ni rtog pa med pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par spangs pas ni rtog pa med pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: The abandonment of activity also explains the absence of investigation.

original: gang na spyod pa med pa de na gdon mi za bar rtog pa yang med pas so //
analyzed: gang na spyod pa med pa de na gdon mi za bar rtog pa yang med pas so //
translated: Where there is no activity, there is no doubt also no thought.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par spangs pas ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par spangs pas ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the abandonment of pleasure and pain‚Äù indicates the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: da ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi lci yang gi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi lci yang gi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the distinction between heavy and light in regard to the wholesome and unwholesome actions that pertain to the desire realm, he says:

original: rtag dang mngon par zhen dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag dang mngon par zhen dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúconstant, intense, and habitual‚Äù and so on.

original: de la las kyi lci ba nyid ni rgyu bzhi po sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bsam pa'i khyad par dang / gnyan po'i khyad par dang / gzhi'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bshad do //
analyzed: de la las kyi lci ba nyid ni rgyu bzhi po sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bsam pa'i khyad par dang / gnyan po'i khyad par dang / gzhi'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bshad do //
translated: Therein, the heaviness of an action is explained in terms of four causes: the particular of application, the particular of intention, the particular of antidotes, and the particular of basis.

original: de la sbyor pa'i khyad par ni las chung du la yang dus ring mo zhig tu sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor pa'i khyad par ni las chung du la yang dus ring mo zhig tu sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the particular of application is the application to even a small action for a long time.

original: las dus yun thung du yang nyon mongs pa dang / rab tu dang ba drag po dang ldan pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par las lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dus yun thung du yang nyon mongs pa dang / rab tu dang ba drag po dang ldan pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par las lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Karma is heavy due to the special intention of possessing strong affliction or strong clarity.

original: las byas pa yang gnyen po stobs dang ldan pas zil gyis mnan na nyam chung dur 'gyur la /
analyzed: las byas pa yang gnyen po stobs dang ldan pas zil gyis mnan na nyam chung dur 'gyur la /
translated: Also, karma that is done is weak if it is overcome by a powerful antidote.

original: las de nyid gnyen po med par gyur na stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las de nyid gnyen po med par gyur na stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That karma becomes strong if it is not overcome by an antidote.

original: gzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te yon tan dang ldan pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te yon tan dang ldan pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'o //

original: de la yon tan dang ldan pa ni dkon mchog gsum dang / gang zag 'gog pa las langs pa la sogs pa kha cig go //
analyzed: de la yon tan dang ldan pa ni dkon mchog gsum dang / gang zag 'gog pa las langs pa la sogs pa kha cig go //
translated: Possessing good qualities refers to the three jewels and some persons such as those arisen from cessation.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni pha dang ma dag dang gzhan yang phan pa khyad par can 'dogs pa dper na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni pha dang ma dag dang gzhan yang phan pa khyad par can 'dogs pa dper na /
translated: Providing benefit refers to one‚Äôs father and mother and others who provide special benefit, for example,

original: sha bkra ba dang dom dang spre'u la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sha bkra ba dang dom dang spre'u la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the spotted deer, the bear, the monkey, and so on.

original: de ltar na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnam pa lnga po de ni 'bras bu nges pa dang / mang po 'byin pa'i phyir chen po ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnam pa lnga po de ni 'bras bu nges pa dang / mang po 'byin pa'i phyir chen po ste /
translated: Thus, these five kinds of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma are great because their effects are certain and abundant.

original: de las khyod kyis mi dge ba yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de las khyod kyis mi dge ba yongs su spangs te /
translated: Therefore, you should completely abandon nonvirtue

original: dge ba spyad pa la brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dge ba spyad pa la brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: and strive to practice virtue.

original: lan tshva srang 'gas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: lan tshva srang 'gas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The phrase even a small amount of salt and so on

original: las chung du ni mang po'i stobs dang ldan pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: las chung du ni mang po'i stobs dang ldan pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhes ston par byed do //
translated: demonstrates that a small karma can be overpowered by the power of many.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni de bas na /üîΩkhyod kyi dge ba ni nyung du mi dge ba ni mang du byas nas 'jigs pa med par yang mi bya la /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni de bas na / khyod kyi dge ba ni nyung du mi dge ba ni mang du byas nas 'jigs pa med par yang mi bya la /
translated: The condensed meaning is that thereforeüîΩyou should not be fearless even if you have done a small amount of virtue and a great amount of nonvirtue.

original: dge ba ni mang du mi dge @89b ba ni nyung du byas nas ha cang skrag par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba ni mang du mi dge @89b ba ni nyung du byas nas ha cang skrag par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And you should not be terrified even if you have done a great amount of virtue and a small amount of nonvirtue.

original: yan lag gi don ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the branches is easy to understand.

original: da ni rgong dang 'gyod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang 'gal ba'i chos rnams ston par byed do //
analyzed: da ni rgong dang 'gyod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang 'gal ba'i chos rnams ston par byed do //
translated: Now, the verse states ‚Äúagitation, regret, etc.‚Äù in order to teach the dharmas that are incompatible with the meditative absorptions and liberations.

original: de dag 'bad de rnam par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'bad de rnam par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should strive to eliminate them.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni sgrib pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni sgrib pa gcig yin no //
translated: Agitation and regret are one hindrance.

original: gnod sems ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod sems ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Malice is the second.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: Drowsiness and lethargy are the third.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Sensual desire is the fourth.

original: the tshom ni lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom ni lnga pa yin no //
translated: Doubt is the fifth.

original: de dag ni sgrib pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni sgrib pa lnga yin te /
translated: These are the five hindrances.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa'i lam la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa'i lam la sgrib pa'i phyir ro // de la rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
translated: Because they hinder the path of the meditative absorptions and liberations.üîΩAmong them, agitation is the lack of tranquility of mind.

original: yid mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'gyod pa ni ngan par byas pa la dmigs pa'i sems la gcags pa ste /
analyzed: yid mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'gyod pa ni ngan par byas pa la dmigs pa'i sems la gcags pa ste /
translated: It is the opposite of mental satisfaction.üîΩRegret is the remorse that focuses on what has been done badly.

original: phyis mi dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyis mi dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the opposite of mental satisfaction.

original: gnod sems ni khong khro ba ste /
analyzed: gnod sems ni khong khro ba ste /
translated: Malice is anger.

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu la rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the nine bases of malice.üîΩThe nine bases of malice are

analyzed: de la kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu ni 'di dag yin te / bdag la gnod par byas so // byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsum tshan dang po dang / bdag gi mdza' bo yid du 'ong ba phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de la gnod par byas so //
translated: three groups of three:üîΩ‚ÄúHe has harmed me, is harming me, and will harm me.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHe has harmed, is harming, and will harm those who are dear and pleasing to me, my friends and relatives.‚Äù

original: byed do ; / byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsum tshan gnyis pa dang bdag dang mi mdza' ba yid du mi 'ong pa gnod par 'dod pa phan par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de la phan par byas so //üîΩbyed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsum tshan gsum pa'o //

translated: ‚ÄúHe has benefited, is benefiting, and will benefit those who are not dear and pleasing to me, my enemies and rivals.‚Äù

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po bcu pa gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba yang brjod do //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po bcu pa gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba yang brjod do //
translated: The tenth basis of malice is the improper object.

original: kun nas mnar sems de ni sngon gyi khon dang 'brel pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems de ni sngon gyi khon dang 'brel pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: This hostility should be understood as related to the prior resentment.

original: rmugs pa ni lus dang sems dag las su mi rung ba nyid do //üîΩgnyid ni gnyid log pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni lus dang sems dag las su mi rung ba nyid do // gnyid ni gnyid log pa'o //
translated: Torpor is the unfitness of the body and the mind.üîΩSleep is the withdrawal of the mind and the mental activities into the body by the power of torpor.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ste /
translated: Desire for sensual pleasure is the passion for sensual desires.

original: sred pa dang mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: sred pa dang mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs yin no //
translated: It is also called craving and attachment.

original: the tshom ni thar pa dang thar pa'i lam la the tshom za ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni thar pa dang thar pa'i lam la the tshom za ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty about the truths and the Buddhist path.

original: sgrib pa lnga po de dag ni dge ba'i nor 'phrog par byed pa nyid kyis chom rkun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po de dag ni dge ba'i nor 'phrog par byed pa nyid kyis chom rkun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These five hindrances are called thieves because they steal the wealth of the roots of virtue.

original: yang ci'i phyir chos gnyis gnyis sgrib pa gcig tu bshad ce na /üîΩg-yo ba dang @90a * //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir chos gnyis gnyis sgrib pa gcig tu bshad ce na / g-yo ba dang @90a * //
translated: Why are two dharmas each taught as a hindrance?

analyzed: blun pa nyid du mthun pa'i phyir te / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni gnyis ka yang g-yo ba yin no //

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni blun pa yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni blun pa yin no //
