original: de ltar bar chad kyi chos rnams bstan nas thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bar chad kyi chos rnams bstan nas thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the phenomena that are obstacles, in order to teach the phenomena that are conducive to liberation,üîΩhe says, faith, effort,

original: dad dang brtson 'grus dag dang dran pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩji ltar thar pa dang 'gal ba'i chos lnga yod pa de bzhin du thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa yang /
analyzed: dad dang brtson 'grus dag dang dran pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ji ltar thar pa dang 'gal ba'i chos lnga yod pa de bzhin du thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa yang /
translated: and so on.üîΩJust as there are five phenomena that are incompatible with liberation,

original: lnga kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lnga kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so too there are exactly five that are conducive to liberation.

original: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang gi mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam skye zhing gnas skabs gzhan du phyin pa la /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang gi mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam skye zhing gnas skabs gzhan du phyin pa la /

original: chos mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The state in which they arise is called the supreme mundane state.

original: chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i ming kho na 'thob pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i ming kho na 'thob pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Not only does one obtain the name supreme mundane state,

original: stobs zhes bya pa dang / dbang po zhes bya ba dang / rtse mo zhes bya ba yang 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stobs zhes bya pa dang / dbang po zhes bya ba dang / rtse mo zhes bya ba yang 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de la stobs zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //

analyzed: dbang po zhes bya pa ni dro ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúfaculty‚Äù refers to the stage of heat.

original: rtse mo zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa'i mjug thogs su skye ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩdbang po lnga bsgom pa ni rgyags pa spang ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas rgyags pa spang par bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: rtse mo zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa'i mjug thogs su skye ba gang yin pa'o // dbang po lnga bsgom pa ni rgyags pa spang ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas rgyags pa spang par bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: The term ‚Äúsummit‚Äù refers to that which arises immediately after the stage of heat.üîΩThe cultivation of the five faculties is preceded by the abandonment of pride.

original: na rga 'chi sdug bral dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: na rga 'chi sdug bral dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the abandonment of pride, he says: ‚Äúthe separation from what is attractive, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag ni na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gsum las kyang ma 'das pa de bzhin du sdug pa dang bral ba dang / las bdag gir bya ba las kyang ma 'das so zhes de ltar sems pa ni /
analyzed: bdag ni na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gsum las kyang ma 'das pa de bzhin du sdug pa dang bral ba dang / las bdag gir bya ba las kyang ma 'das so zhes de ltar sems pa ni /
translated: One should think in the following manner: ‚ÄúI have not transcended these three dharmas that are called: disease, old age and death. Similarly, I have not transcended the separation from what is attractive and the experience of the results of karma.‚Äù

original: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gnyen po'i rgyags pa 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gnyen po'i rgyags pa 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since this is the counteragent to pride, the pride that is destroyed is the pride that has a counteragent.

original: de la las bdag gir bya ba nyid ni las ji lta ba bzhin bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la las bdag gir bya ba nyid ni las ji lta ba bzhin bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe self is the owner of the karma‚Äù means that happiness and suffering arise in accordance with the karma.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the rest is self-evident.

original: gal te mtho ris thar pa mngon bzhed na //
analyzed: gal te mtho ris thar pa mngon bzhed na //
translated: If you desire heaven and liberation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf you desire heaven and liberation,‚Äù etc.,

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po skye ba'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po skye ba'i rgyu ston to //
translated: teaches the cause for the arising of the faculties of faith, etc.

original: yang dag lta la goms pa dag tu mdzod //
analyzed: yang dag lta la goms pa dag tu mdzod //
translated: You should cultivate right view.

original: ces bya ba de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni tshe phyi ma la legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu 'byung bar yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni tshe phyi ma la legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu 'byung bar yid ches pa ste /
translated: Right view is the conviction that the results of good and bad karma arise in a future life.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du yid ches pa @90b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du yid ches pa @90b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the conviction that there is a world beyond.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba de lta bu med na sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa gang cung zad cig yod kyang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba de lta bu med na sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa gang cung zad cig yod kyang /
translated: If you do not have such right view, then whatever little good you do, such as generosity,

original: thams cad rnam par smin pa mi bzad ldan //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par smin pa mi bzad ldan //
translated: will all be accompanied by terrible karmic ripening.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúWhatever little good you do, such as generosity,‚Äù etc.,

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: teaches the result of right view.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba can kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dan to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba can kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dan to //

original: de lta bas na yang dag pa'i lta ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang dag pa'i lta ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that right view is the cause for the generation of all roots of virtue.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate the cause of disenchantment, he says:

original: da ni mi ni yang dag nyid du mi bde zhing //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas skyo ba'i rgyu ston te /
analyzed: da ni mi ni yang dag nyid du mi bde zhing // zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyo ba'i rgyu ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúHumans are, in reality, not happy,üîΩnot permanent, not healthy, not self, and impure.‚Äù

original: mi bde zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bde zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot happy‚Äù means ‚Äúsuffering.‚Äù

original: mi rtag ces bya ba ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot permanent‚Äù means ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot self‚Äù means ‚Äúdevoid of an inner agent, a person.‚Äù

original: mi gtsang ba ni sungs pa dang rul ba'i mi gtsang ba nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ni sungs pa dang rul ba'i mi gtsang ba nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúImpure‚Äù means ‚Äúendowed with the impurity of corruption and putrefaction.‚Äù

original: mi ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis legs par brtags na de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: mi ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis legs par brtags na de lta bu yin no //
translated: Humans are like this when examined well with right wisdom.

original: gang dag dran pa nye bar ma bzhag pa de dag ni log par 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang dag dran pa nye bar ma bzhag pa de dag ni log par 'dzin to //
translated: Those who are not established in the foundations of mindfulness are mistaken.

original: des na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: des na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault in that?

original: dran pa nye bar ma bzhag rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar ma bzhag rnams kyis ni //
translated: Those who are not established in the foundations of mindfulness

original: phyin ci log bzhir lta ba phung khrol pa //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhir lta ba phung khrol pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: have the four mistaken views, which are a disaster.

original: phyin ci log bzhi ni sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log dang sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log go //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi ni sdug bsngal ba la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log dang sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log go //
translated: The four mistaken views are: the mistaken notion, thought, and view that what is suffering is happiness;

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du 'du shes phyin kyi log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du 'du shes phyin kyi log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang /
translated: and similarly, the mistaken notion, thought, and view that what is impermanent is permanent, what is selfless is a self, and what is impure is pure.

original: phyin ci log tu lta ba de ni ngan song dang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba de ni ngan song dang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These mistaken views are the cause of bad rebirths and cyclic existence.

original: phung krol ba ste /
analyzed: phung krol ba ste /
translated: They are a disaster.

original: de lta bas na khyod kyis mi ni sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyod kyis mi ni sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //

original: gal te mi sdug pa dang / mi rtag pa dang mi gtsang ba ni yin grang na /
analyzed: gal te mi sdug pa dang / mi rtag pa dang mi gtsang ba ni yin grang na /
translated: If you say that it is not beautiful, impermanent, and impure,

original: bdag med pa yin par rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag med pa yin par rtogs par mi nus te /

original: bdag gcig med na /
analyzed: bdag gcig med na /
translated: If there is no self,

original: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu su zhig spyod snyam du sems na ;üîΩgzugs ni bdag ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu su zhig spyod snyam du sems na ; gzugs ni bdag ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: then who experiences the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions?üîΩForm is not the self.

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Buddha said, ‚ÄúThe self is not form, and so on up to:üîΩConsciousness is not the self.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being explained.

original: bdag gcig yod na gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo ba nyid gcig yin pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag gcig yod na gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo ba nyid gcig yin pa 'am /
translated: If there were a self, it would be the same entity as form and so on,

original: de las gzhan pa zhig yin par 'gyur grang /üîΩre zhig gzugs la sogs @91a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhig yin par 'gyur grang / re zhig gzugs la sogs @91a * //
translated: or it would be something different from them.üîΩFirst, it is not the same entity as form and so on.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //

original: gzugs ni bdag ma yin gsungs la /
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag ma yin gsungs la /

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang bdag ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang bdag ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha said, ‚ÄúConsciousness is not the self.‚Äù

original: re zhig 'di ni lung gi bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni lung gi bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no //

original: 'di la rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa gang yin zhe na /

original: bdag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The self is not the reality of form and so on,

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ba kho nar mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa zhig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa zhig yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is different from form and so on,

original: de la rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩdes lhas byin ba lang dang ldan pa lta bur gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhig yin pa'am /üîΩdper na lhas byin re lde la 'dug pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa zhig yin pa'am /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum ste / des lhas byin ba lang dang ldan pa lta bur gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhig yin pa'am / dper na lhas byin re lde la 'dug pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa zhig yin pa'am /
translated: then there are three possibilities.üîΩIt would be like Devadatta possessing an ox, possessing form and so on,üîΩor like Devadatta sitting on a bench, it would be based on form and so on,

original: dper na 'khri shing dang gel pa la sogs pa sa la brten pa ltar de la gzugs la sogs pa brten pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: dper na 'khri shing dang gel pa la sogs pa sa la brten pa ltar de la gzugs la sogs pa brten pa zhig yin grang /
translated: or like vines and creepers supported by trees, it would be supported by form and so on.

original: 'di'i lan go rims bzhin du bdag gzugs dang ldan min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i lan go rims bzhin du bdag gzugs dang ldan min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The self is not said to possess form, etc.

original: re zhig 'di ni lung yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni lung yin no //
translated: This is the scriptural response.

original: rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The rational response is as follows:

original: bdag gzugs la sogs pa la dbang ba ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: bdag gzugs la sogs pa la dbang ba ci zhig yod de /
translated: What power does the self have over form, etc.?

original: lhas byin ba lang rnams la bkol ba dang / bzho ba la sogs pa bya bar dbang ba ltar de'i 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa 'dor ba dang len pa ni med do //
analyzed: lhas byin ba lang rnams la bkol ba dang / bzho ba la sogs pa bya bar dbang ba ltar de'i 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa 'dor ba dang len pa ni med do //
translated: The self does not have the power to discard or adopt form, etc., as it pleases, as Devadatta has the power to employ and milk cows.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du yang gzugs la sogs pa 'jig pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du yang gzugs la sogs pa 'jig pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the disintegration of form, etc. is seen even without the self‚Äôs desire,

original: ji ltar 'di de dang ldan no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di de dang ldan no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: how can it be said that the self possesses form, etc.?

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang ji ltar 'di gzugs la sogs pa gnas pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang ji ltar 'di gzugs la sogs pa gnas pa zhes brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos la ni lhas byin re lde la 'dug pa ltar bla 'og tu gnas par rung ba ma yin no //

original: gang gis na de dag na gnas pa mngon par gyur pa de la gnas pa'i bdag gis kyang gzugs la sogs pa la phan cung zad kyang mi 'dogs la gzugs la sogs pas kyang de la phan cung zad kyang mi 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang gis na de dag na gnas pa mngon par gyur pa de la gnas pa'i bdag gis kyang gzugs la sogs pa la phan cung zad kyang mi 'dogs la gzugs la sogs pas kyang de la phan cung zad kyang mi 'dogs so //
translated: But the self that exists in those places does not benefit form, etc. in the least, nor do form, etc. benefit it in the least.

original: 'on te 'di de la zhon nas de dag 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te 'di de la zhon nas de dag 'jug par byed de /
translated: But if you say that the self mounts them and makes them function,

original: dper na rta la zhon nas rta bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rta la zhon nas rta bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a rider on a horse,

original: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa mthong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa mthong pa'i phyir /
translated: Because we see that they function and stop without the self‚Äôs desire,

original: @91b bdag gis 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: @91b bdag gis 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: and form, etc. function and stop without the self‚Äôs desire.

original: phyogs gsum pa la rigs pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa la rigs pa ni /

original: khri shing la sogs pa ni sa la brten ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: khri shing la sogs pa ni sa la brten ba nyid yin te /
translated: because a throne, etc. is supported by the ground,

analyzed: de la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'phel ba mthong ba'i phyir ro//

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bdag la rag las pa ma yin te /

original: bdag med bzhin du yang phyi'i gzugs la sogs par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med bzhin du yang phyi'i gzugs la sogs par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because form, etc. are seen to exist even when the self does not.

analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na rtsva la sogs pa srog yod pa de dag ltar na lan tshva la sogs pas ma nges pa yin no //

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ni ye shes kyi rdo rjes bshig nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ni ye shes kyi rdo rjes bshig nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection are destroyed by the vajra of wisdom and one attains the fruit of stream entry.

original: da ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med pa yongs su spang ba'i sgo nas dngos po rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med pa yongs su spang ba'i sgo nas dngos po rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the cause of the arising of things by way of completely abandoning discordant causes and causelessness, he says:

original: phung po 'dod rgyal las min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phung po 'dod rgyal las min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The aggregates do not arise from God, etc.

original: 'dod rgyal zhes bya ba ni gnam babs so //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal zhes bya ba ni gnam babs so //
translated: The chance is the chance-born.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni dus su smra ba rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos rtag pa khyab pa gcig pu zhig kun brtags pa ste ;
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni dus su smra ba rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos rtag pa khyab pa gcig pu zhig kun brtags pa ste ;
translated: The time is the one permanent, pervasive cause imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, who are proponents of time, for the arising and destruction of all things.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dus ni 'byung ba rnam smin byed //üîΩdus ni skye dgu rnam 'jig byed //
analyzed: dus ni 'byung ba rnam smin byed // dus ni skye dgu rnam 'jig byed //
translated: Time is the ripening of the elements.üîΩTime is the destruction of living beings.

analyzed: dus ni gnyid log rnam sad byed //
translated: Time is what awakens those who are asleep.

original: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //

analyzed: rnal 'byor goms pas thob pa'i blo can bsam gtan yul /
translated: The object of the meditation of the wise who have attained yoga is

translated: It is true that there is no result, but that is because the other causes are incomplete.

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig rgyu ji snyed cig skye ba las gal te de dag tshogs kyang dngos po de mi skye na 'dod rgyal gyis byas so zhes bya bar gsal bar shes so //

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin ni 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te /

original: rang bzhin spyod par bya ba ma yin te /

original: rtag pa'i phyir skyes bu lta bu kho na'o //

original: skyes bu spyod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu spyod par byed pa yang ma yin te /

original: rtag pa'i phyir rang bzhin lta bu kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir rang bzhin lta bu kho na'o //

original: rang bzhin chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi rten yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi rten yang ma yin te /

original: rtag pa'i phyir skyes bu lta bu kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir skyes bu lta bu kho na'o //

analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: de la dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni spyi dang khyad par du bstan par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: rang gi rigs kyis byas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas /

analyzed: de lta bu rnams phan tshun za ba ni shin tu mi bzad pa yin te /

analyzed: kha cig ni mu tig gi phyir 'chi bar 'gyur ro // kha cig ni bal gyi phyir ro //

analyzed: bkres skom zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bkres pa dang skom pa dang grang ba dang dro ba dang / ngal ba dang 'jigs pa zhes bya bar tshig bsdus te /

original: sdug bsngal de 'dra ba'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de 'dra ba'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: de ltar yi dags rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: ro gcig ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar chad med pa nyid du ston par byed do //

original: skye bo 'jungs dga' ba /
analyzed: skye bo 'jungs dga' ba /
translated: ‚ÄúStingy people who delight in hoarding‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: means

original: skye bo 'jungs pa ni skye bo ser sna can te /
analyzed: skye bo 'jungs pa ni skye bo ser sna can te /

original: de dag la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la dga' ba'o //
translated: They delight in that.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na ;
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na ;
translated: What is that?

analyzed: ser sna 'phags min zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin ba nyid ni nyon mongs pa can nyid la rig par bya'o //

analyzed: ser sna de ni yi dags kyi 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyu yin par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Lord Buddha has said that miserliness is the cause for rebirth in the ghost realm.

original: bdag cag ser sna can rnams ni //
analyzed: bdag cag ser sna can rnams ni //
translated: We miserly people

original: mig tshugs she dag lta lta nas //
analyzed: mig tshugs she dag lta lta nas //
translated: Stare with unblinking eyes

original: sbyin pa chung zad ma stsal des //
analyzed: sbyin pa chung zad ma stsal des //
translated: Because we have not given even a little in charity,

original: bdag cag yi dags 'jig rten lhags //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag yi dags 'jig rten lhags // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: We have come to this ghost realm.

original: lha'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lha'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the suffering of the god realm, it is said:

analyzed: mtho ris na yang bde chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even in the higher realms, there is no great bliss,

original: mtho ris dag na lha'i bu mo sgeg ma dang gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba dag gis bde ba chen po nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: mtho ris dag na lha'i bu mo sgeg ma dang gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba dag gis bde ba chen po nyams su myong ngo //
translated: In the higher realms, the gods experience great pleasure with the beautiful celestial maidens and with various objects such as form.

original: de na bde ba de 'dra ba yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de na bde ba de 'dra ba yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there is such pleasure there,

original: de dag gi 'chi 'pho'i sdug bsngal nyid 'chi ba'i dus ni yid shin tu mi bde ba 'byung ba ni bde ba de bas kyang che'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'chi 'pho'i sdug bsngal nyid 'chi ba'i dus ni yid shin tu mi bde ba 'byung ba ni bde ba de bas kyang che'o //
translated: the suffering of death and transmigration is greater than that pleasure. At the time of death, there is a great mental anguish.

original: de ltar bsams nas ya rabs rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas ya rabs rnams kyis ni //
translated: Having reflected in this way, the noble ones

original: zad 'gyur mtho ris slad du sred mi bgyi //
analyzed: zad 'gyur mtho ris slad du sred mi bgyi //
translated: do not crave for the perishable higher realms.

original: ya rabs yin yang zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi mtho ris la dga' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ya rabs yin yang zad par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi mtho ris la dga' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not delight in the higher realms, which have the nature of perishing, even if one is noble.

original: lha rnams la gnad 'chad pa'i tshor ba med pa'i phyir ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: lha rnams la gnad 'chad pa'i tshor ba med pa'i phyir ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung zhe na /
translated: Since the gods do not have the feeling of cutting vital parts, why does the suffering of death and transmigration arise for them?

original: lus kyi kha dog mi sdug 'gyur ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lus kyi kha dog mi sdug 'gyur ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, The body's color becomes ugly, etc.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: de dag la gnad 'chad pa'i tshor ba med pas lus kyi sdug bsngal med mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag la gnad 'chad pa'i tshor ba med pas lus kyi sdug bsngal med mod kyi /
translated: They do not have physical suffering, since they do not have the sensation of cutting the vital parts.

original: 'chi 'pho pa'i snga ltas rnams mthong na sems shin tu sdug bsngal ba ni @104a * //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho pa'i snga ltas rnams mthong na sems shin tu sdug bsngal ba ni @104a * //
translated: But when they see the signs of death and the signs of the life force leaving the body, they experience mental suffering.

original: 'byung ste / ji skad du /
analyzed: 'byung ste / ji skad du /
translated: As the text says:üîΩThen a god, crying out in distress,

original: de nas lha'i bu zhig snying rje rje skad du ngu zhing /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu zhig snying rje rje skad du ngu zhing /
translated: wails:

original: kyi hud dal gyis 'bab /üîΩkyi hud rdzid bu zhes smre sngags 'don to zhes rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: kyi hud dal gyis 'bab / kyi hud rdzid bu zhes smre sngags 'don to zhes rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Alas, slow-flowing river!üîΩAlas, my garden!

original: lha rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba'i snga ltas kyi sdug bsngal de dag kyang lnga yin te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba'i snga ltas kyi sdug bsngal de dag kyang lnga yin te /
translated: The suffering of the gods at death and transmigration is also fivefold:

original: 'di lta ste sngon gyi kha dog phun sum tshogs pa med pas lus kyi mdog mi sdug pa dang / rang gi stan la mi dga' ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba rnyings pa dang / gos la dri ma chags pa dang lus las rdul 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sngon gyi kha dog phun sum tshogs pa med pas lus kyi mdog mi sdug pa dang / rang gi stan la mi dga' ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba rnyings pa dang / gos la dri ma chags pa dang lus las rdul 'byung ba'o //
translated: their bodies become ugly, their former perfect complexion disappears; they no longer enjoy their seats; their flower garlands fade; their clothes pick up stains; and sweat appears on their bodies.

original: de ltar na gang dag mthong nas lha rnams yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar na gang dag mthong nas lha rnams yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, the gods are unhappy when they see these five signs.

original: mtho ris 'chi 'pho sbron byed snga ltas lnga //
analyzed: mtho ris 'chi 'pho sbron byed snga ltas lnga //
translated: Five signs announce the death of the gods.

original: lha yul lha'i 'jig rten na gnas pa'i lha rnams la 'byung ste /
analyzed: lha yul lha'i 'jig rten na gnas pa'i lha rnams la 'byung ste /
translated: These five signs appear to the gods who are in the celestial abodes of the realm of desire.

original: mi rnams kyi 'chi bar 'gyur ba sbron pa'i snga ltas bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi 'chi bar 'gyur ba sbron pa'i snga ltas bzhin no //
translated: They are like the signs that announce the death of humans.

original: dper na khrus byas shing byug pas brkus pa gang yin pa zhig gi snying dang por tsha ba dang / rna ba ma bkag par sgra mi thos pa de ni ring por mi thogs par 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na khrus byas shing byug pas brkus pa gang yin pa zhig gi snying dang por tsha ba dang / rna ba ma bkag par sgra mi thos pa de ni ring por mi thogs par 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, when a person who has bathed and anointed himself with unguents feels a burning sensation in his heart and hears a sound without any noise reaching his ear, he will die before long.

original: lha yi 'jig rten dag nas 'phos pa la //
analyzed: lha yi 'jig rten dag nas 'phos pa la //
translated: The gods who have fallen from the celestial abodesüîΩThe gods are not only unhappy when they see these five signs;

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lha rnams la sdug bsngal de tsam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lha rnams la sdug bsngal de tsam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: they also experience suffering after death.üîΩThe gods who have fallen from the celestial abodes

original: de nas shi 'phos pa rnams la yang 'byung ba kho na 'o zhes bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos pa rnams la yang 'byung ba kho na 'o zhes bya ba de ston te /
translated: experience the suffering of death and of falling into a painful realm.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni lha'i 'jig rten nas shi 'phos pa la gal te lha dang mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba cung zad kyang med na slar ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni lha'i 'jig rten nas shi 'phos pa la gal te lha dang mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba cung zad kyang med na slar ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: If those who die in the world of the gods have not even a little virtue that would lead to rebirth among gods and humans, then they will certainly experience suffering again in the three lower realms.

original: lha ma yin gyi sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩlha min dag na'ang rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas / lha min dag na'ang rang bzhin gyis //
translated: With regard to the suffering of the demigods,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúAnd among the demigods, by nature there isüîΩthe suffering of conflict and the suffering of separation.‚Äù

original: lha ma yin rnams la ni rang bzhin gyis snyems pa'i nga rgyal las skyes pa'i nga rgyal yod /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams la ni rang bzhin gyis snyems pa'i nga rgyal las skyes pa'i nga rgyal yod /
translated: The demigods have a pride that arises from natural conceit,

original: de dag kyang nga rgyal che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang nga rgyal che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and they are also proud because of their greatness.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal bshad do //
translated: Therefore, this explains the suffering of afflictive kles‚Äôa.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba smos bas ni g-yul 'gyed pa'i tshe lus kyi sdug bsngal yang 'byung ngo zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba smos bas ni g-yul 'gyed pa'i tshe lus kyi sdug bsngal yang 'byung ngo zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúnaturally‚Äù shows that there is also the suffering of pain in their bodies when they fight.

original: lha'i dpal la sdang phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni snyems pa'i nga rgyal las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ston par byed do //
analyzed: lha'i dpal la sdang phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni snyems pa'i nga rgyal las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ston par byed do //
translated: This shows the cause of suffering that arises from the pride of conceit.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It also shows the suffering of the defilement of birth.

original: de dag blo @104b dang ldan na yang //
analyzed: de dag blo @104b dang ldan na yang //
translated: Even though they have intelligence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: they are not able to see the truth.

original: gal te 'di dag la dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par dpyod par nus pa'i blo yod du zin kyang 'on kyang 'gro ba'i sgrib pas bden pa mthong ba ni med do //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag la dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par dpyod par nus pa'i blo yod du zin kyang 'on kyang 'gro ba'i sgrib pas bden pa mthong ba ni med do //
translated: Even though they have the intelligence to investigate what is wholesome and unwholesome, they are not able to see the truth because of the obscuration of the realm of existence.

original: 'gro ba de nyid gang bden pa mthong ba'i rten gyi ngo bor mi 'gyur ba de lta bur med ge ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba de nyid gang bden pa mthong ba'i rten gyi ngo bor mi 'gyur ba de lta bur med ge ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa yin te /
translated: They are projected by karma that is obscured, in the sense that it does not become the basis for seeing the truth.

original: de bas na sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called an obscuration.

original: lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba'i 'phen par byed pa ni mi dge ba'i las yin la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni dge ba kho na yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba'i 'phen par byed pa ni mi dge ba'i las yin la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni dge ba kho na yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is held that the projection of the realm of existence of the demigods is done by unwholesome karma, but its completion is done by wholesome karma.

original: lha'i 'gro ba ni 'phen par byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yang dge ba yin pas /
analyzed: lha'i 'gro ba ni 'phen par byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yang dge ba yin pas /
translated: The divine life is virtuous both in its projection and in its completion.

original: lha'i 'gro ba las lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba 'gro ba gzhan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lha'i 'gro ba las lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba 'gro ba gzhan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the life of the demigods is established as a separate life from the divine life.

original: mi'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par ni logs shig tu bshad de /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par ni logs shig tu bshad de /
translated: The specific suffering of the human life is explained separately.

original: sbyir des pa 'dod pas phongs dang 'chi ba dang // na dang rgas sogs sdug bsngal du ma yin //
analyzed: sbyir des pa 'dod pas phongs dang 'chi ba dang // na dang rgas sogs sdug bsngal du ma yin //
translated: The human life is a source of many sufferings, such as the suffering of poverty, death, sickness, old age, and so on.

original: 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa kho nas bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / sngar yang mi rnam pa du mas smad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩda ni de ltar 'khor ba'i nyes pa bshad nas de la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes nye bar bsgrub par /
analyzed: 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa kho nas bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / sngar yang mi rnam pa du mas smad pa'i phyir ro // da ni de ltar 'khor ba'i nyes pa bshad nas de la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes nye bar bsgrub par /
translated: This is because it has already been taught by the words ‚Äúsource of suffering‚Äù and so on, and because the human life has already been criticized in many ways.

original: 'khor ba de 'dra lags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'khor ba de 'dra lags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, after explaining the faults of cyclic existence in this way, in order to establish the perception of aversion to cyclic existence, he says, ‚ÄúCyclic existence is like that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'khor ba nyes pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir lha la sogs par skye ba ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'khor ba nyes pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir lha la sogs par skye ba ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Since cyclic existence is thus defective, therefore birth as a god, etc. is not good.

original: de ltar khyad par du skye ba'i nyes pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar khyad par du skye ba'i nyes pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the defect of birth in particular,

original: mir skye ba ni gnod ba du ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mir skye ba ni gnod ba du ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: birth as a human is a vessel for many harms, etc.

original: skye ba ni nye du'i gnod pa la sogs pa gnod pa du ma'i snod du gyur cing rten du gyur pa yin par shes par gyis shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni nye du'i gnod pa la sogs pa gnod pa du ma'i snod du gyur cing rten du gyur pa yin par shes par gyis shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: You should understand that birth is a vessel and a basis for many harms, such as the harm of relatives.

original: de ltar 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba bskyed nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba bskyed nas /
translated: Having thus generated a sense of dispassion for the entire world,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhug pa'i phyir /üîΩmgo 'am gos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhug pa'i phyir / mgo 'am gos la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to lead to nirvana,üîΩhe says, if your hair or clothes should suddenly catch fire,

original: mgo la me shor ram gos la me shor na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mgo la me shor ram gos la me shor na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: you should apply yourself to extinguishing the fire on your hair or clothes.

original: de dag phyir bzlog bgyi ba btang nas kyang //
analyzed: de dag phyir bzlog bgyi ba btang nas kyang //
translated: Even if you let go of the effort to extinguish them,

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gsad pa yang btang nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gsad pa yang btang nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: this means even if you give up killing them.

original: yang srid med par bgyi slad 'bad 'tshal te //üîΩzhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i brtson 'grus chen po de lta bu yang srid med par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya dgos @105a * //
analyzed: yang srid med par bgyi slad 'bad 'tshal te // zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i brtson 'grus chen po de lta bu yang srid med par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya dgos @105a * //
translated: Strive to make an end of rebirth.

original: so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This great effort, which is not concerned with either body or life, should be made in order to put an end to rebirth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di bas ches mchog dgos pa gzhan ma mchis //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di bas ches mchog dgos pa gzhan ma mchis // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because there is no other purpose higher than this.

original: 'di bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i dgos pa gzhan ni med kyi /
analyzed: 'di bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i dgos pa gzhan ni med kyi /
translated: There is no other purpose higher than this.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don gyi dam pa ni 'di kho nar zad do snyam du dgongs pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don gyi dam pa ni 'di kho nar zad do snyam du dgongs pa yin no ;
translated: The highest human goal is just this.

original: / yang srid med pa yang ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: / yang srid med pa yang ji ltar 'thob ce na /
translated: How is the end of rebirth attained?

original: tshul khrims dag dang bsam gtan shes rab kyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dag dang bsam gtan shes rab kyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: bslab pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having completed the three trainings, attain nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de la yang rnam pa gnyis te phung po'i lhag ma med pa dang / phung bo'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de la yang rnam pa gnyis te phung po'i lhag ma med pa dang / phung bo'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: And that nirvana is of two kinds: with a remainder of the aggregates and without remainder of the aggregates.

original: de la phung po'i lhag ma med pa ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ston to //üîΩphung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa ni dbang po ngul bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phung po'i lhag ma med pa ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ston to // phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa ni dbang po ngul bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: Of these, the one without remainder of the aggregates is taught by the word ‚Äúpeace‚Äù because it is distinguished by the complete pacification of suffering.

original: dul ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ston to //üîΩgnyi ga yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma nye bar zhi bas /
analyzed: dul ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ston to // gnyi ga yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma nye bar zhi bas /
translated: The one with a remainder of the aggregates is taught by the word ‚Äútamed‚Äù because it is distinguished by the subduing of the faculties.

original: dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa ste /
translated: And both are taught by the word ‚Äústainless‚Äù because of the complete pacification of the stains of passion, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i go 'phang gnas de lta bu thob cing rab tu thob par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i go 'phang gnas de lta bu thob cing rab tu thob par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: ‚ÄúAttain that state called nirvana, which is attained by the complete pacification of the stains of passion, etc.‚Äù

original: mi rga mi 'chi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa de nyid kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas bsngags pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rga mi 'chi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa de nyid kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas bsngags pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: By the words ‚Äúhe does not age, he does not die,‚Äù etc., he explains the praise of that very nirvana by way of its special qualities.

original: de la dengs pa med pas na mi rgas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dengs pa med pas na mi rgas pa'o //
translated: Since there is no passing away in it, it is not old age.

original: 'chi bar mi 'gyur bas na mi 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar mi 'gyur bas na mi 'chi ba'o //
translated: Since there is no death, it is not death.

original: zad pa med pas na mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa med pas na mi zad pa'o //
translated: Since there is no exhaustion, it is not exhaustion.

original: lhag mas ni phyi rol pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te chen po bzhi dang nyi ma dang zla ba dag med par bshad do //
analyzed: lhag mas ni phyi rol pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te chen po bzhi dang nyi ma dang zla ba dag med par bshad do //
translated: The rest is stated in order to distinguish it from the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the non-Buddhists: the four great elements, the sun and moon do not exist.

original: da ni chos gang dag mngon du gyur pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos gang dag mngon du gyur pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach those dharmas through which nirvƒÅ·πáa is attained, he says:

original: dran dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dran dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Mindfulness, etc.

original: de la dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Therein, mindfulness is not forgetting the object.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni de la shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni de la shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: Discernment of dharmas is the wisdom that is directed towards that.

original: brtson 'grus ni mngon par sbro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni mngon par sbro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the endeavor that is directed towards that.

original: dga' ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la yid bde ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la yid bde ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Joy is the mental satisfaction that is directed towards that.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems las su rung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems las su rung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Tranquility is the serviceability of body and mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: btang snyoms @105b ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rnal du 'dug pa dang lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms @105b ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rnal du 'dug pa dang lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the state of mind and mental factors remaining in their natural condition and operating spontaneously.

original: chos bdun po de dag ni byang chub zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos bdun po de dag ni byang chub zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: These seven factors are called the limbs of enlightenment because they are limbs of the uncontaminated wisdom of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste 'khor du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste 'khor du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are called limbs because they are members of the retinue of enlightenment.

original: dge tshogs lags zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩshes rab med la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos gzhan gnyis po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge tshogs lags zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // shes rab med la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos gzhan gnyis po 'di lta ste /
translated: The collection of virtue is the cause of enlightenment.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab dag mngon du gyur pas /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par ston te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab dag mngon du gyur pas / mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par ston te /
translated: The next two verses show that nirvana is attained through the actual practice of concentration and wisdom.

original: de gnyis zung du 'brel pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gnyis zung du 'brel pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Nirvana is attained through the union of these two.

original: de gnyis ni phan tshun gyi stobs kyis 'grub par ston to //üîΩshes rab med la bsam gtan yod min la //
analyzed: de gnyis ni phan tshun gyi stobs kyis 'grub par ston to // shes rab med la bsam gtan yod min la //
translated: These two are shown to be established by the power of each other.üîΩThere is no meditative concentration for one without wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bsam gtan legs par bskyed mi shes pa de ni 'dir shes rab med pa yin par dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bsam gtan legs par bskyed mi shes pa de ni 'dir shes rab med pa yin par dgongs pa yin te /
translated: One who does not know how to properly generate meditative concentration is considered here to be without wisdom,

original: de la ni bsam gtan mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de la ni bsam gtan mi 'grub po //
translated: because meditative concentration is not accomplished for him.

original: bsam gtan med par yang ni shes rab yod min te //
analyzed: bsam gtan med par yang ni shes rab yod min te //
translated: And there is no wisdom without meditative concentration.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan med par yang gang gi chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ba'i shes rab med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan med par yang gang gi chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ba'i shes rab med de /
translated: Without meditative concentration, there is no wisdom by which phenomena are known as they are,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that one knows the truth just as it is through the mind being in equipoise.

original: gang la de gnyis ka yod pa de 'khor ba gnag rjes lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de gnyis ka yod pa de 'khor ba gnag rjes lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: One who has both of these should be known to be like a dog‚Äôs footprint in a river.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang la skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab med pa de la bsam gtan mi 'grub la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang la skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab med pa de la bsam gtan mi 'grub la /
translated: Or, in another way, meditative concentration is not accomplished for one who lacks wisdom obtained from birth.

original: bsam gtan med par yang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab mi 'grub kyi gang la shes rab dang bsam gtan de gnyi ga yod la de'i 'khor ba gnag rjes lta bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan med par yang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab mi 'grub kyi gang la shes rab dang bsam gtan de gnyi ga yod la de'i 'khor ba gnag rjes lta bur rig par bya ste /
translated: Also, wisdom born of meditation is not accomplished without meditative stabilization.

original: myur ba kho nar brgal bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur ba kho nar brgal bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should know that the cyclic existence of those who have both wisdom and meditative stabilization is like the black lines seen by one with an eye disease, because they are able to cross over it quickly.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa'i chos 'di rnams kyi bar chad du gyur pa bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas la sems pa /
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa'i chos 'di rnams kyi bar chad du gyur pa bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas la sems pa /
translated: Now, one should consider the non-virtuous states that are obstacles to these dharmas which cause the attainment of nirvana.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir lung ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir lung ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to turn one away from them, the verse states, ‚Äúneutral states, etc.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa bcu bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa bcu bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: The Tathagata taught fourteen neutral things. What are the fourteen?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig rten rtag pa dang / 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang yin mi rtag pa yang yin pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin @106a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa dang / 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang yin mi rtag pa yang yin pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin @106a * //
translated: The world is eternal, the world is not eternal, the world is both eternal and not eternal, the world is neither eternal

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa dang /
translated: the world is finite, the world is infinite, the world is both finite and infinite, the world is neither finite nor infinite,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shi phan chad yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa dang /
translated: the TathƒÅgata exists after death, the TathƒÅgata does not exist after death, the TathƒÅgata both exists and does not exist after death, and the TathƒÅgata neither exists nor does not exist after death,

original: srog gang yin pa de lus yin pa dang / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: srog gang yin pa de lus yin pa dang / srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and that the life-force is the same as the body, and that the life-force is one thing and the body is another.

original: dngos po bcu bzhi po 'di dag ni dris na lung mi bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dngos po bcu bzhi po 'di dag ni dris na lung mi bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa zhes bshad de /
translated: These fourteen things are called indeterminate because they are not to be taught when asked about.

original: 'di nyid gzhag par bya ba'i dri ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhag par bya ba'i dri ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that they are questions to be set aside.

original: gnas 'di dag ni bsam par bya ba yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: gnas 'di dag ni bsam par bya ba yang ma yin no ;
translated: These topics are not to be reflected upon.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yis blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩ'di skad du gang zhig bsams na phan pa thob pa'am /
analyzed: de yis blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // 'di skad du gang zhig bsams na phan pa thob pa'am /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the mind is disturbed by them.‚Äù

original: bde ba thob par 'gyur ba de bsam par bya ba yin na gnas 'di dag ni bsams pas ni sems zhi bar skyed par mi 'gyur bas bsam par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba thob par 'gyur ba de bsam par bya ba yin na gnas 'di dag ni bsams pas ni sems zhi bar skyed par mi 'gyur bas bsam par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant: If one reflects on something and thereby attains benefit or attains happiness, then that is to be reflected upon. But these topics are not to be reflected upon, because if one reflects on them, the mind does not generate tranquility.

original: de ltar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas yongs su spang bar bshad nas gang zhig bsams na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa 'di rnams skye bar 'gyur bde la sems nye bar gtad par /
analyzed: de ltar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas yongs su spang bar bshad nas gang zhig bsams na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa 'di rnams skye bar 'gyur bde la sems nye bar gtad par /
translated: Having explained the avoidance of topics that are not to be reflected upon, he explains the mental focus on that which is to be reflected upon, in order to generate the factors of enlightenment.

original: mi shes pa las las te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ston te /
analyzed: mi shes pa las las te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ston te /
translated: This teaches the twelve factors of dependent origination.

original: 'di dag gi don ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi don ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these should be understood in accordance with the sutra.

original: de la mdo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo ni 'di yin te /
translated: The sutra states:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: From the condition of ignorance, there are actions.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: From the condition of actions, there is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: From the condition of consciousness, there is name and form.üîΩFrom the condition of name and form, there are the six sense bases.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /üîΩreg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: From the condition of the six sense bases, there is contact.üîΩFrom the condition of contact, there is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: From the condition of feeling, there is craving.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: From the condition of craving, there is grasping.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: From the condition of grasping, there is existence.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: From the condition of existence, there is birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre @106b sdags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre @106b sdags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Due to the condition of birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife arise.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: de ltar lugs dang mthun pa'i dbang du byas te bshad nas lugs las bzlog pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩskye ba 'gags pas 'di kun 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar lugs dang mthun pa'i dbang du byas te bshad nas lugs las bzlog pa'i dbang du byas nas / skye ba 'gags pas 'di kun 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: Having explained this in terms of forward progression, in terms of reverse progression,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: When birth ceases, all this ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: When birth ceases, the phenomena of aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife cease.

original: de ltar ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas ni srid pa 'gag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas ni srid pa 'gag par 'gyur la /
translated: When birth ceases, existence ceases.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on up to: ‚ÄúWhen ignorance ceases, the conditioning factors cease.

original: ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: mdo nyid las gang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: mdo nyid las gang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The S≈´tra itself teaches: ‚ÄúIt is the non-knowing of what is past, etc.

original: 'dir mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is a summary:

original: bden pa rnams mi shes pa ni don dam par ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mi shes pa ni don dam par ma rig pa yin no //
translated: The non-knowing of the Truths is ignorance in the ultimate sense.

original: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Non-knowing is the opposite of knowing.

original: byis pa ma rig pa de dang ldan pa'i las dge ba dang mi dge pa dang mi g-yo ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams yin no //
analyzed: byis pa ma rig pa de dang ldan pa'i las dge ba dang mi dge pa dang mi g-yo ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams yin no //
translated: The actions of the ignorant person, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or non-agitated, are the conditioning factors conditioned by ignorance.

original: mdo las ni lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las ni lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The S≈´tra says: ‚ÄúThe conditioning factors are the volitions of body, speech, and mind.

original: de skad du gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs mod kyi /
translated: ‚Äù Although this is so,

original: 'on kyang 'dir ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las smos pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las smos pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: here it should be understood that the volitions of body, speech, and mind are mentioned.

original: las de'i sa bon gang yin pa des bsgos pa'i sems ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: las de'i sa bon gang yin pa des bsgos pa'i sems ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is imbued with the seed of that action is consciousness conditioned by karmic formations.

original: mdo las ni 'bras bu rgyus bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'bras bu rgyus bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In the sutra, the result is taught in terms of the cause.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it says, ‚Äúthe six collections of consciousness.‚Äù

original: dper na tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyi dbang po rnams ni rab tu dangs zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyi dbang po rnams ni rab tu dangs zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúVenerable One, your faculties are very clear.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni phra ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni phra ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ba ma yin te ;
translated: In the same way, the consciousness that is the result of evolution is not to be taught in terms of its own nature, because it is subtle.

original: 'bras bu bstan par mdzad do //üîΩrnam par shes pa de yang 'du byed rnams kyis rim pa gang gis ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa 'phangs pa'i rim pa de kho nas rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir /
