original: zab pa nyid ni rang gis ma byas pa dang / gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / gnyi gas ma byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zab pa nyid ni rang gis ma byas pa dang / gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / gnyi gas ma byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya'o //
translated: Its profundity should be understood as not being produced by itself, not being produced by another, not being produced by both, and not arising without a cause.

original: 'di ltar rang las kyang mi skye /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang las kyang mi skye /
translated: Thus, it does not arise from itself.

original: gzhan las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ma yin /
translated: Nor do they arise from other.

original: gnyis ga las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis ga las kyang ma yin /
translated: Nor do they arise from both.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang mi skye'o //
translated: Nor do they arise without a cause.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams te /
translated: However, formations are conditioned by ignorance.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true for the remaining [links].

original: rnam pa gcig tu nam rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams bskyed par bya'o snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu nam rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams bskyed par bya'o snyam du mi sems /
translated: In one aspect, ignorance also does not think, ‚ÄúI generate formations.‚Äù

original: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pas bskyed do snyam du mi sems la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pas bskyed do snyam du mi sems la /
translated: Nor do formations think, ‚ÄúWe are generated by ignorance.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa med par yang 'du shes rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yang sngon la byed pa po ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa med par yang 'du shes rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yang sngon la byed pa po ni mi dmigs te /
translated: However, if there were no ignorance, formations would not occur.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that dependent origination is profound.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i lam bsgom par nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i lam bsgom par nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who is skilled in dependent origination is able to cultivate the path that observes the four noble truths, it is said:

original: yang dag lta dang 'tsho dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang dag lta dang 'tsho dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right samadhi.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: Right view is uncontaminated wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni kha gsag dang log pa'i 'tsho ba spang ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni kha gsag dang log pa'i 'tsho ba spang ba'o //
translated: Right livelihood is the avoidance of hypocrisy and wrong livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus te /
translated: Right effort is vigor.

original: de yang yang dag par spang ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par spang ba bzhi'o //
translated: It is also the four right efforts.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni /
translated: Right mindfulness is

original: dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: not forgetting the object.

original: de yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos la dmigs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: de yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos la dmigs pa rnams yin te /
translated: It is the four foundations of mindfulness, which are the objects of mindfulness of the body, feelings, mind, and mental objects.

original: dran pa nyid dran pa nye bar 'jog pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: dran pa nyid dran pa nye bar 'jog pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: Mindfulness itself is the foundation of mindfulness, because it is the foundation of mindfulness.

original: gang dag 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pas zhes 'chad pa de dag gi gzhung lugs kyis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes rab yin no //
analyzed: gang dag 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pas zhes 'chad pa de dag gi gzhung lugs kyis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes rab yin no //
translated: According to the system of those who explain that one is called a foundation of mindfulness because mindfulness is well established in this, the foundations of mindfulness are wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge @109a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge @109a * //
translated: Right samadhi is

original: 'dzin ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth meditation is the holding.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni ngag gi dge ba'i las kyi lam bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni ngag gi dge ba'i las kyi lam bzhi'o //
translated: Right speech is the four paths of action of the body.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni lus kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam spong ba'i rang bzhin gsum mo //üîΩyang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gnod sems med pa'i rtog pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni lus kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam spong ba'i rang bzhin gsum mo // yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gnod sems med pa'i rtog pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Right action is the three kinds of action of the body which consist of the abandonment of the three bad actions of the body.üîΩRight thought is the various kinds of good thoughts, such as the thought of non-violence, the thought of renunciation, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtog pa rnams pa du ma ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtog pa rnams pa du ma ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the right thought.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po 'di ni zhi bar bgyi ba'i slad du ste /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po 'di ni zhi bar bgyi ba'i slad du ste / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bgyi'o //
translated: These eight members of the noble path are to be cultivated in order to attain Nirvana.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam 'di'i dmigs par gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam 'di'i dmigs par gyur /
translated: This is the object of the noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the four noble truths,

original: skye 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skye 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says: ‚ÄúThis birth, etc.‚ÄùüîΩWhat are the four?

original: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o//
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o//
translated: The truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of suffering?

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is called the suffering of birth.üîΩIn brief, it is the five aggregates of attachment that are suffering.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no //
translated: Birth, which is characterized by the five aggregates of attachment, is the truth of suffering.

original: skye ba de yang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba de yang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: That birth should be understood as suffering because of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: de nyid la dgongs nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid la dgongs nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: With that in mind, it is said that the five aggregates of attachment are suffering.

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: In the sutras,

original: skye ba sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: skye ba sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par mdzad do //
translated: it is taught as the suffering of birth and so on.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden p gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden p gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the origin of suffering?

original: sred pa zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: sred pa zhes bgyi ba /
translated: It is called craving.

original: de ni de yi kun 'byung rgya chen te //
analyzed: de ni de yi kun 'byung rgya chen te //
translated: That is the great origin of it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa /üîΩdga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa //
translated: Craving for renewed existence is:

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Together with the delight and lust for that and that.

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / 'byung ba'i sred pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sred pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / 'byung ba'i sred pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sred pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is to say, craving for sense-desires, craving for becoming, and craving for non-becoming.

original: de yi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi'o //
analyzed: de yi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to suffering.

original: 'di las sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas na kun 'byung ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di las sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas na kun 'byung ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since suffering originates from that, it is the origin, which means cause.

original: rgya chen te zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i dmigs pa mang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rgya chen te zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i dmigs pa mang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat‚Äù shows that the object of craving is manifold.

original: de lta ma yin na ni 'di rgya chen po nyid du rung ba ma yin no//üîΩ@109b de la yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni 'di rgya chen po nyid du rung ba ma yin no// @109b de la yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be suitable as ‚Äúgreat.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover, ‚Äúexistence‚Äù means

original: yang srid pa la zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa la zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: existence in a new birth.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang lhan cig pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang lhan cig pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Together with the delight of attachment means together with the delight of attachment.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Delighting in this and that means

original: yang srid pa la dmigs pa nyid du ston par byed do ;
analyzed: yang srid pa la dmigs pa nyid du ston par byed do ;
translated: it shows that it is the object of renewed existence.

original: /'dod pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Craving for desire means the object of the desire realm.

original: 'byung ba'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Craving for becoming means the object of the form and formless realms.

original: 'jig pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid med par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid med par dmigs pa'o //
translated: Craving for non-becoming means the object of non-self.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of cessation?

original: 'di 'gog pa ni thar pa lags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni thar pa lags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: This cessation is liberation.

original: kun 'byung ba 'di 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni thar pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'di 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni thar pa yin no //
translated: Whatever cessation of this origination is liberation.

original: de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This should be known as the truth of cessation.

original: sred pa de nyid gtan 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba gang yin pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa de nyid gtan 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba gang yin pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that ‚Äúthe cessation and complete pacification of that craving itself is nirvana.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na 'dir sred pa zad pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston to //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir sred pa zad pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston to //
translated: Therefore, the teaching here that ‚Äúthe extinction of craving is nirvana‚Äù shows nirvana with a remainder of the aggregates.

original: lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the path?

original: 'thob bgyid 'phags lam yan lag de brgyad lags //
analyzed: 'thob bgyid 'phags lam yan lag de brgyad lags //
translated: It is the eightfold path of the noble ones, which leads to the attainment of nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa'i lam gyi bden pa ni gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bshad ma thag pa de yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa'i lam gyi bden pa ni gang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bshad ma thag pa de yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The truth of the path that leads to the attainment of nirvana is the eightfold path of the noble ones that was just explained.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Thus, the four noble truths are applied to the attainment of nirvana.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ltar lam bsgom pa ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas rtag tu dus thams cad du brtson par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ltar lam bsgom pa ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas rtag tu dus thams cad du brtson par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one should always, at all times, strive in the cultivation of the path in the manner explained.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag / mthong bar bgyi slad de /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag / mthong bar bgyi slad de /
translated: Why is that?üîΩFor the sake of seeing the four noble truths.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong bar bya ba'i don du'o //üîΩ'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa gang dag yin pas na //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong bar bya ba'i don du'o // 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa gang dag yin pas na //
translated: For the sake of seeing the four noble truths.üîΩWhat are the noble ones' truths?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The noble ones' truths.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pas bden pa nyid du gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pas bden pa nyid du gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the noble ones, such as the stream-enterers, see them as truths.
